Since we have no attribute overrides for api-paste.ini, no

commit_message:
Remove api-paste.ini as it provided by package

Since we have no attribute overrides for api-paste.ini, no
need to have a template resource for it.  Until we need to
have some attribute, removing this will take away burden of
keeping in sync with base openstack code.

Change-Id: I8ebf93a04916789afc8125303e372ed285b0d799
Related-Bug: #1433152

commit_message:
Enable delta-driven datasources

Ensure that datasources capable of publishing deltas for their data
can send those deltas to Congress, instead of having Congress pull
an entire snapshot of their full data periodically.

Change-Id: Ia48a8a0020a0469e6d781922916af8266a1b7d3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 09:47:42.000000000', 'message': "Treat all negative quota values as -1

Currently if the quota_port, quota_network, quota_subnet values
in the neutron.conf are set to a negative value not equal to -1,
neutron reports the values as is to consumers like Nova.
Nova treats -1 as the infinite quota indicator and doesn't expect
neutron to return any other non-negative value.

The fix allows the flexibility of having any negative number for the
quota parameters in the neutron.conf file and allows the nova boot
to succeed subsequently. The fix would report any negative value
as -1 for port, subnet and network.

Change-Id: Ib9a7136b0bfd01bdf04a5d0937854590029b1010
Closes-Bug: 1438738
Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Treat all negative quota values as -1

Currently if the quota_port, quota_network, quota_subnet values
in the neutron.conf are set to a negative value not equal to -1,
neutron reports the values as is to consumers like Nova.
Nova treats -1 as the infinite quota indicator and doesn't expect
neutron to return any other non-negative value.

The fix allows the flexibility of having any negative number for the
quota parameters in the neutron.conf file and allows the nova boot
to succeed subsequently. The fix would report any negative value
as -1 for port, subnet and network.

Change-Id: Ib9a7136b0bfd01bdf04a5d0937854590029b1010
Closes-Bug: 1438738
Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>

subject: Tune keystone settings to fail-over faster

  and detect it differently so the divergence of hash function is 5

* Decrease socket_timeout from 3 seconds to 1 second to detect lost backend
  faster
* Increase pool size from 100 to 1000 connections.

Closes-Bug: 1432242

commit_message:
Tune keystone settings to fail-over faster

* Reduce dead_retry from 300 to 30. When 3 servers lost memcached server
  and detect it differently so the divergence of hash function is 5
  minutes.
* Decrease socket_timeout from 3 seconds to 1 second to detect lost backend
  faster
* Increase pool size from 100 to 1000 connections.

Closes-Bug: 1432242

Change-Id: Ib16a9cba4de8442afa2b78770cb93f561b0fd37e
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit b001daf6c6352b1dac2a7339299ba1fa7d010c1e)

commit_message:
Make DSE hierarchical

Turn DSE into a hierarchical message bus, meaning that each
node on the message bus can either be a standard pub/sub node
or an entire message bus itself.

Change-Id: I2242edfcdf67a007eb50b24fc57b883ff62cc70e

commit_message:
Remove api-paste.ini as it provided by package

Since we have no attribute overrides for api-paste.ini, no
need to have a template resource for it.  Until we need to
have some attribute, removing this will take away burden of
keeping in sync with base openstack code.

Change-Id: I4cb0aec2dc39c9b7f4c8096f24acc28399ae95a8
Closes-Bug: #1433152

[{'created': '2015-03-25 22:18:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add identity_uri_transform to help move to identity_uri

Starting on the identity_uri blueprint.  A difference
between the public auth_uri and the admin identity_uri is that
the identity_uri does not include the path/version (/v2.0).
And the auth_uri has to modify the version depending upon
the needs of the environment.
There existed a helper routine called, auth_uri_transform, so
to be consistent and make this easy to follow, I created a
identity_uri_transform which simply removes the path/version
from the uri given.

This helper will then be used thru out the cookbooks to make
the switch to the identity_uri very easy.

I guess the alturnatives are messing with our generic endpoint
definitions/methods, but since they are used for many different
purposes, I think having another matching transform method is the
right way to go here.

Change-Id: I035a4491945c600dea8feb317b357a1a69da28cd
Implements: blueprint identity-uri

commit_message:
Add identity_uri_transform to help move to identity_uri

Starting on the identity_uri blueprint.  A difference
between the public auth_uri and the admin identity_uri is that
the identity_uri does not include the path/version (/v2.0).
And the auth_uri has to modify the version depending upon
the needs of the environment.
There existed a helper routine called, auth_uri_transform, so
to be consistent and make this easy to follow, I created a
identity_uri_transform which simply removes the path/version
from the uri given.

This helper will then be used thru out the cookbooks to make
the switch to the identity_uri very easy.

I guess the alturnatives are messing with our generic endpoint
definitions/methods, but since they are used for many different
purposes, I think having another matching transform method is the
right way to go here.

Bumped version for adding new method which other cookbooks will
depend upon.

Change-Id: I035a4491945c600dea8feb317b357a1a69da28cd
Implements: blueprint identity-uri

commit_message:
Converted End User Guide section and clean up

1. RST conversion of Configure access and security for instances section
2. RST conversion of Launch instance from a volume section
3. Markup consistency edits to files
4. Actioned TODO comments

Change-Id: Ica08b5a3fab457a8415016d098873da0e1cb6b94

Hi,

Can we please take this patch in its current state, and make fixes in followup patches? This patch comes from work back in January from the networking guide. Currently, there is very little quality documentation on the internals of Neutron and how to deploy it, and some documentation that has a couple errors here and there is preferable to no documentation.'}, {'account_id': 4656, 'date': '2015-04-02 00:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The reason I'm pushing for this is because this patch was extracted from

https://github.com/ionosphere80/openstack-networking-guide/blob/master/scenario-provider-ovs/scenario-provider-ovs.md

And people are starting to use that link to read. I would like to get this merged quickly so that we can remove that content from GitHub and point them over to the permanent location for the content, and avoid having changes made in both the GitHub repo and here."}, {'account_id': 7751, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Let me quickly make these changes.'}, {'account_id': 7751, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7751, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7751, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I too would love to bring this in and avoid confusion, let me know if I can help.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 7751, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-23 22:10:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix for rabbit user issue.

This creates the rabbit user to admin instead of guest. This is
important for multi setups and also to confirm that we don't leverage
the guest user for aio.

Change-Id: I98d5c14badd8e1230a4f13d4d50a6c54556c19af
Closes-Bug: 1434304
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for rabbit user issue.

This creates the rabbit user to admin instead of guest. This is
important for multi setups and also to confirm that we don't leverage
the guest user for aio.

Change-Id: I98d5c14badd8e1230a4f13d4d50a6c54556c19af
Closes-Bug: 1434304

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-05 00:20:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix ubuntu ml2_conf missing ovs section

Used the existing ovs conf as a partial template to simply include
in the ml2 conf.  This keeps all the attributes the same.
A more detailed spec will have to be done after some refactoring
to allow for sections to be tested.

Please give this idea a try, it seems to allow me to setup neutron
on ubuntu with ml2. I'm working toward using this as a basis for
getting the repo aio_neutron test working.

Change-Id: Ia988f3d7ef1c280c40b55cea4f455710f673dd32
Closes-Bug: #1314751

Please give this idea a try, it seems to allow me to setup neutron
on ubuntu with ml2. I'm working toward using this as a basis for
getting the repo aio_neutron test working.

Change-Id: Ia988f3d7ef1c280c40b55cea4f455710f673dd32
Closes-Bug: #1314751
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ubuntu ml2_conf missing ovs section

Used the existing ovs conf as a partial template to simply include
in the ml2 conf.  This keeps all the attributes the same.
A more detailed spec will have to be done after some refactoring
to allow for sections to be tested.

Please give this idea a try, it seems to allow me to setup neutron
on ubuntu with ml2. I'm working toward using this as a basis for
getting the repo aio_neutron test working.

Change-Id: Ia988f3d7ef1c280c40b55cea4f455710f673dd32
Closes-Bug: #1314751

I don't see how it may work. Have you tried this?

You use '/var/log/ceph/$cluster-$name.log' for $rgw_log_file. So it will set in ceph.conf

log_file = /var/log/ceph/$cluster-$name.log

$cluster and $name will be interpreted by ceph daemons depending on their names. But $rgw_log_file is also used in other places, e.g. in the manifest we have:

    file { $rgw_log_file:
      ensure => present,
      mode   => '0755'
    }

So it will create file '/var/log/ceph/$cluster-$name.log' (without $cluster and $name substituted).

If you want a simple working solution it might be (not tested):

1) Don't set log_file in ceph.conf so the default is used. For rgw it will be '/var/log/ceph/ceph-client.admin.log'. For osd it will be e.g. '/var/log/ceph/ceph-osd.0.log'
2) Set $rgw_log_file to /var/log/ceph/ceph-client.admin.log so other directives that create and set permissions work.

But I am not sure, there might be an issue with log file handling for other daemons, like /var/log/ceph/ceph-osd.0.log -- we want have directives for this."}, {'account_id': 15373, 'date': '2015-04-01 12:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Actually, analyzing how the init sctipt works, it looks like the solution could be just to remove this string from ceph/manifests/conf.pp:

 'global/log_file':                           value => $::ceph::rgw_log_file;

We have in ceph/manifests/radosgw.pp:

  "client.${rgw_id}/log_file":      value => $rgw_log_file;

so this still will be used for radosgw, while for other daemons the default log location will be used, which looks reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 13948, 'date': '2015-04-02 07:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14774, 'date': '2015-04-02 07:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Started  (2/2) Ubuntu'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-02 07:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

Is this change covered by logrotate?'}, {'account_id': 13948, 'date': '2015-04-02 08:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Logrotate is set to all *.log files from /var/log/ceph.'}, {'account_id': 14774, 'date': '2015-04-02 09:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Successful 

http://tpi-logs.mirantis.com/review.vsphere/162639/4/CentOS : SUCCESS

http://tpi-logs.mirantis.com/review.vsphere/162639/4/Ubuntu : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 15373, 'date': '2015-04-02 10:34:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

The change looks reasonable to me, in the sense that after the change I expect ceph.conf is generated correctly: there is no 'log_file' parameter in [global] section and 'log_file' is set to '/var/log/ceph/radosgw.log' in [client.radosgw.gateway] section, i.e. the default value is used by all daemons except radosgw.

I have no idea if additional changes are requiered to cope with the ceph logs (e.g. logrotate configuration)."}, {'account_id': 8786, 'date': '2015-04-02 18:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-02 18:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Verified

There is a possibility that an OSD host will run many OSD deamons, so it
is better idea to log messages to different files.

Note that '$cluster-$name.log' is a default value set by Ceph. In
result, radosgw messages are no longer saved in radosgw.log, but in
ceph-client.admin.log. The best solution is to modify daemon init script

maintain them on our own, what seems no worth the hassle.

commit_message:
Use default log filenames for Ceph OSD nodes

There is a possibility that an OSD host will run many OSD deamons, so it
is better idea to log messages to different files, as it's done by
default.

Change-Id: Ief8186006386af8ae7e40cffeeaeef5a5c0f3c70
Closes-Bug: 1428693

commit_message:
Verify whether interface is already bridge member

Sometimes interface may be automatically added to bridge if config file exists
before interface creation, especially vlan interfaces. It appears on CentOS.

Change-Id: I093a5f7c93d03c413b0a1417776139ba5a707e66
Closes-bug: #1437400

commit_message:
Retry docker builds without cache in build-app/-lp

In case "docker build" fails in the lp-cedarish
build-app and build-lp scripts, just retry with the --no-cache
option. Common function added to contrib/common/utils
for reuse.

Change-Id: Iac3f294c8d3a3b938d4a6a88b4a2679f82c2cb7e

commit_message:
devstack: Add --config poll_time 10 when creating drivers

The default poll_time is 10 seconds. Here we also specify it in the devstack
config as well.

Change-Id: I2503c819bc19abf50f1553da4abd2d7a30705d59

[{'created': '2015-03-12 14:45:00.000000000', 'message': 'Keep libvirt and device-mapper in sync on rhel

These two packages are inter dependent for how nova uses them, but the
packages are not linked with dependencies.  So, with rhel 7, if the
libvirt package get installed/updated, we should do the same with
the device-mapper to try to keep them in sync.

Change-Id: I0444a8ac4d42093f5b39787e867d9ac70c0e8263
Closes-Bug: #1431387
'}]
commit_message:
Keep libvirt and device-mapper in sync on rhel

These two packages are inter dependent for how nova uses them, but the
packages are not linked with dependencies.  So, with rhel 7, if the
libvirt package get installed/updated, we should do the same with
the device-mapper to try to keep them in sync.

Change-Id: I0444a8ac4d42093f5b39787e867d9ac70c0e8263
Closes-Bug: #1431387

commit_message:
Resolve the db migration dependency in Neutron

Most of the code of advance services is splited from Neutron,
except create db tables. So there will be errors when execute db
migration of advance services before Neutron. It is a dependency
of db migration.
To avoid erros caused by db dependency, create a recipe to handle
all the db migration for Neutron and advance services. With that
the advance services db migration can be handle after related
tables are created by Neutron db migration.

Change-Id: I502976f34977fae4f2df831382593560a56caa92
Closes-Bug: #1438148

- gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-style http://logs.openstack.org/59/167559/2/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-style/fd4e972/ : SUCCESS in 4m 00s

(1 comment)

An inline question about this change.  Should this be the default or dynamically added to the attr in the api recipe, I know we do that sort of thing in other places.

Other have comments on what approach is better?'}, {'account_id': 14655, 'date': '2015-03-25 13:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Mark,  We had thought about it.Following are the reason we are doing this unconditionally

a) controller node should be able to support all types of images including docker types in order to support mixed cloud creation. 

b) Even if the controller supports docker images - it will not in anyway affect other types of images

In case of other changes like compute and telemetry  - we have done it based on conditional basis.

Thanks,
Sudheesh'}, {'account_id': 14655, 'date': '2015-03-25 13:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

When we initially create a cloud we may have docker computes not available. But later the same cloud can be expanded to a mixed cloud where we have some of the computes docker types. To enable controller nodes to allow upload docker images well before (or not tightly coupled with whether cloud has docker computes yet) docker computes added/configured- supports for these images can be made default. In this way - we will be able to handle mixed clouds. Even if we enable the support - it will not harm in anyway'}, {'account_id': 7128, 'date': '2015-03-30 14:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14570, 'date': '2015-03-30 15:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

As Sudheesh commented above, this change just enables glance to accept docker type images, just like all the other supported images. Since a cloud can be deployed with just one hypervisor type compute nodes (say kvm) later new nodes can always be added, which can be of Docker type. So, this change allows adding those nodes seamlessly without change on controller at that time. Enabling it by default will not harm anything but will make it easier to add docker compute nodes later.'}, {'account_id': 12323, 'date': '2015-04-02 20:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-02 20:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

Starting gate jobs.

commit_message:
Introducing docker changes to openstack-image

This includes cookbook-openstack-image changes required to enable
docker type container formats which includes docker and dockerref

Implements: bluerprint docker-driver-configuration

Change-Id: I21effcac1be2a07e01e37c0d1eb4ca2c57ef2127

Previously, the vxlan kernel module was not being loaded. This
causes the following error when trying to start the lb-agent
when using the vxlan type driver:

ERROR neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent
[-] Linux kernel vxlan module and iproute2 3.8 or above are
required to enable VXLAN.

Change-Id: I1c9f5d13d25e887d15270a96d35f41a08316c8f0
'}]
commit_message:
Adds vxlan kernel module to Heat template

Previously, the vxlan kernel module was not being loaded. This
causes the following error when trying to start the lb-agent
when using the vxlan type driver:

ERROR neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent
[-] Linux kernel vxlan module and iproute2 3.8 or above are
required to enable VXLAN.

Change-Id: I1c9f5d13d25e887d15270a96d35f41a08316c8f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-09 06:42:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for aggregates like SUM/COUNT in Datalog

The current implementation of datalog-aggregates
support count in rule, which calculate the row count
of other table and fills the head.

e.g error(x,y):- p(x), count(y)
Here y refers to the the row count of p(x)

Change-Id: I05bf77c8e1e76a36aabce6433ac36422a4fda22e
blueprint: datalog-aggregates
'}, {'created': '2014-12-17 12:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for aggregates like SUM/COUNT in Datalog

Support for "count" in policy rule, where count
is restricted to be the last in the rule.
error(x,y):- p(x), count(x,y)
Here y holds the count for x in other table.

Set of tests are available with this patch for
verifying count functionality.

Change-Id: I05bf77c8e1e76a36aabce6433ac36422a4fda22e
blueprint: datalog-aggregates

commit_message:
Add support for aggregates like SUM/COUNT in Datalog

Support for "count" in policy rule, where count
is restricted to be the last in the rule.
error(x,y):- p(x), count(x,y)
Here y holds the count for x in other table.

Set of tests are available with this patch for
verifying count functionality.

Change-Id: I05bf77c8e1e76a36aabce6433ac36422a4fda22e
blueprint: datalog-aggregates

appropriate marker function according to the marker function

commit_message:
Fix missing translations for log messages

Fixed log translations for error, info and warning messages with
appropriate marker function according to the standards [1].

As LOG.warn has deprecated [2] so I have changed LOG.warn to
LOG.warning.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
[2] http://bugs.python.org/issue13235

Change-Id: I876c6f3636d511664a25508649e08ad95c40007a
Closes-Bug: 1431256

commit_message:
Fixed issue with waiting for ssh of deleted cluster

If we will delete cluster during waiting for ssh,
check_cluster_exists will be unreachable. 
We should move it up.

Change-Id: I3935269ad7b8a771490f193653d73b17d4b30708
Closes-bug: 1439396

commit_message:
Add functional test for notify.logger

To make sure notify.logger always play well with messaging(v2) driver.
Achieve this by seting up a logger with target logging handler, doing real
logging, finally check notifications that receive from message broker.

Change-Id: I234457974ca48689b9dfc9f7c72b4ea37a57a40b

commit_message:
README cleanup, fix project mentions

- This is a StackForge project now, it should be reflected such
- Cleanup references to OpenStack (and associated projects)
- Sundry cleanup

Change-Id: I26b0900badeb2a1770a8159f2c16745404887548

Flush out the readme in preparation for the first release

This commit adds some details the README about the included utils and
starts the Release Notes section in prepartion for pushing the first
release.

commit_message:
Create bind endpoints for dashboard

These will allow greater control and consistency with configuring
endpoint across openstack.

commit_message:
Modify glance content for Kilo

Modify glance content for Kilo as follows:

1) Change [keystone_authtoken] section to use auth_plugin.

2) Remove log_dir option because Ubuntu init scripts overwrite
   it with command-line options.

3) Add note about differing stock configuration files and usage
   of ellipsis in configuration snippets.

Change-Id: I092a569d56897630fde396286e626a2972df8b80
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Modify neutron content for Kilo

Modify neutron content for Kilo as follows:

1) Change python-keystoneclient to python-openstackclient.

2) Move RabbitMQ configuration to [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
   section.

3) Use "openstack" account for RabbitMQ.

4) Change [keystone_authtoken] and [nova] sections to use
   auth_plugin.

5) Add note about differing stock configuration files and usage
   of ellipsis in configuration snippets.

6) Change database version to 'head' until release.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I98e76a82cb329680e0c653286c9681fb1a9f67de

The sahara client calls are now using key=value argument passing
everywhere. This allows the arguments to be listed in any order and not
cause errors when a new argument is added.

Closes-Bug: #1439155
'}, {'created': '2015-04-02 11:30:04.000000000', 'message': '[Sahara] fix sahara client calls

The sahara client calls are now using key=value argument passing
everywhere. This allows the arguments to be listed in any order and not

commit_message:
[Sahara] fix sahara client calls

The sahara client calls are now using key=value argument passing
everywhere. This allows the arguments to be listed in any order and not
cause errors when a new argument is added.

Change-Id: I3b2304b6c56fb88d280e5b58484bcdb189e04a9d
Closes-Bug: #1439155

commit_message:
remove extraneous +x bits from lib files

2 files had execute bits set on them, fix as a cleanup. These files
should not be directly executed.

Change-Id: Ic0fdb85d77a3b47ef777524faf4fcdb0d8cedece

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 11:38:01.000000000', 'message': "minimize the default services

This changes the default service list in devstack to minimize what is
running out of the box, so that it's likelihood of working in a 4G vm
is much higher.

This removes heat from the default enabled service list.

It drops the ec2 only needed n-obj and n-crt services.

It drops all the alternative consoles (xvnc, consoleauth). novnc is
fine for libvirt which is the default.

It adds dstat, because that's turned out to be so useful in debugging
things.

Change-Id: I84457260dff6f42a5c6ebcc2c60fb6e01aec9567
"}]
commit_message:
minimize the default services

This changes the default service list in devstack to minimize what is
running out of the box, so that it's likelihood of working in a 4G vm
is much higher.

This removes heat from the default enabled service list.

It drops the ec2 only needed n-obj and n-crt services.

It drops all the alternative consoles (xvnc, consoleauth). novnc is
fine for libvirt which is the default.

It adds dstat, because that's turned out to be so useful in debugging
things.

Change-Id: I84457260dff6f42a5c6ebcc2c60fb6e01aec9567

[{'created': '2015-02-04 17:50:09.000000000', 'message': "Don't create block device mappings in the API cell

Otherwise 2 block_device_mapping entries will be created
in the API cell:
- the first one (created by the API cell) will have close to
  no information about the volume (device_name and volume_id are NULL)
- the second one (bubbled up from the compute cell) will contain
  all the volume information

The first entry confuses Nova when creating an image since
it won't be able to find the associated volume (NULL) in Cinder.

The compute cell should create it first and propagate it up
to the API cell.

commit_message:
Don't create block device mappings in the API cell

Otherwise 2 block_device_mapping entries will be created
in the API cell:
- the first one (created by the API cell) will have close to
  no information about the volume (device_name and volume_id are NULL)
- the second one (bubbled up from the compute cell) will contain
  all the volume information

The first entry confuses Nova when creating an image since
it won't be able to find the associated volume (NULL) in Cinder.

The compute cell should create it first and propagate it up
to the API cell.

Change-Id: I38edb953e73de6bc70a2e5950c68f457f83303e1
Closes-bug: #1417239
(cherry picked from commit 58633c4f085fc21be1e6439bb3d60d7492358d4a)

[{'created': '2015-03-26 22:18:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not erase_devices while in devstack

Erase devices in VMs ends up running shred on the drives for the agent
driver, which is incredibly slow and completely unneeded in devstack.
Adding this option disables erase_devices, which is a needed
prerequisite to testing Ironic cleaning in devstack.

This is related to the Ironic blueprint "implement-cleaning-states".

Change-Id: I77081165a80491da3e66d8a4554b6d71fc3d9353
'}, {'created': '2015-03-26 22:26:12.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare devstack for Ironic cleaning testing

successfully test cleaning in devstack.

ends up running shred on the drives for the agent driver, which is
incredibly slow and completely unneeded in devstack.

Additionally, we allow Ironic more time to complete the unprovision

commit_message:
Prepare devstack for Ironic cleaning testing

This patch changes the two config options required for Ironic to
successfully test cleaning in devstack.

First, we disable erase_devices clean step. Erase devices in VMs
ends up running shred on the drives for the agent driver, which is
incredibly slow and completely unneeded in devstack.

Additionally, we allow Ironic more time to complete the unprovision
after the nova instance is deleted. This time is spend in the CLEANING
state to clean up the node.

This is related to the Ironic blueprint "implement-cleaning-states".

Change-Id: I77081165a80491da3e66d8a4554b6d71fc3d9353

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 18:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tenant_id without delegate role if same

The tenant_id query parameter can be specified without the
monitoring delegate role if it matches the tenant_id from the
token used for posting a metric

Posting of a metric to a different tenant_id still requires the
monitoring delegate role

Change-Id: Icdba4c67ecae13d47aa3d6726fe4f9501f4bece6
Closes-bug: #1439392
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tenant_id without delegate role if same

The tenant_id query parameter can be specified without the
monitoring delegate role if it matches the tenant_id from the
token used for posting a metric

Posting of a metric to a different tenant_id still requires the
monitoring delegate role

Change-Id: Icdba4c67ecae13d47aa3d6726fe4f9501f4bece6
Closes-bug: #1439392

Updating port may change port-host binding, but creating port should not.(To create one to replace original invalid one is not what I'm saying.)"}, {'account_id': 13667, 'date': '2015-03-19 09:56:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

BTW, why won't you update the UT, the  class TestMl2PluginCreateUpdateDeletePort?"}, {'account_id': 13667, 'date': '2015-03-19 14:38:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

When I try to write to a patch try to remove method _get_host_port_if_changed, I find the reason why we need this method, update_port needs it!

To create_port and create_port_bulk, after we create new port, notification should be done for new port, and previous host binding should be invalid, so directly call notify with mech_context.current as parameter makes sense.

But to update_port, if the port host binding doesn't change, the notification could be ignored. The return value 'None' in this case will be useful, _notify_l3_agent_new_port will check this 'None' port, and do nothing."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-04-02 19:51:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

bug no longer reproducible'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-22 04:58:58.000000000', 'message': 'DVR qrouters not created on compute Node when vm added

DVR qrouters should be created dynamically on compute
nodes, when VM are created on a routed network.

A recent patch that addressed "Move Post commit ops
out of transaction for bulk" introduced this bug.

It basically changed the order in which the call such
as _get_host_port_if_changed is called. This function
need to be called before the _process_port_binding but
it has been called out of order and so the ml2/plugin
does not call the _notify_l3_agent_new_port.

The current patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: I0b2d0e5c3ede6127ffad28dcb7bdc9f66d6f3d97
Closes-Bug: #1411883

commit_message:
DVR qrouters not created on compute Node when vm added

DVR qrouters should be created dynamically on compute
nodes, when VM are created on a routed network.

A recent patch with the change id mentioned below
I9a9683058088e50d9443040223232bf5e1396ccf have
introduced this bug.

It basically changed the order in which the call such
as _get_host_port_if_changed is called. This function
need to be called before the _process_port_binding but
it has been called out of order and so the ml2/plugin
does not call the _notify_l3_agent_new_port.

The current patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: I0b2d0e5c3ede6127ffad28dcb7bdc9f66d6f3d97
Closes-Bug: #1411883

I second Rossella's concerns. I struggle to see the validity of this fix due to lack of context. Why do you think the existing logic is flawed?"}, {'account_id': 13667, 'date': '2015-02-13 05:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

@Rossella Sblendido, @Armando Migliaccio
I wish I can explain my point clear:
#### background ####
In DVR case, we will run l3-agent on compute nodes. So when an instance is created on a router's subnet on that node, a port creating operation will be invoked in ml2, as you see, the method create_port in ml2 plugin, and then l3-agent on compute nodes should know this and do something, as what in https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/DVR_L2_Agent#New_VM_added_to_a_subnet_interface_of_a_distributed_router talks about from its section from line 2.
And the notification entrance should be _notify_l3_agent_new_port in method create_port in ml2 plugin.
#### investigation ####
However, in DVR case, currently after an instance created on a router's subnet on a compute node, that node seems received nothing notification about this. I tested another case, creating an instance on a no islet subnet, then attached this subnet on to a router, related netns will be created on the instance host. So I confirm no notification sent should be the reason why no qrouter netns created on compute nodes after instances created on router's subnet.
#### code logic ####
the method _notify_l3_agent_new_port may not send notification in multiple cases, one of them is it received a None as port parameter. So I checked method _get_host_port_if_changed. It will return mech_context.current if port binding host changed, or None(python method default return value) if port binding host not changed. And in common case, the port binding host will no changed, so a None returned. So by that, logic in _notify_l3_agent_new_port consider nothing need to notify and it return, but what indeed it should do is to notify the new created port. So I consider we should do a simple check here.
Sure, I still need read more neutron code and know more details, but to DVR case, I think we should fix here, or overwrite that wiki for logic conflict."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-02-13 06:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Can you check if you are witnessing this issue being reported/addressed here?

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149143/

Please do not assume that the code is in sync with the wiki, as it might not be the case.'}, {'account_id': 13667, 'date': '2015-02-13 06:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Armando Migliaccio
I find that issue from bugs launchpad for I get the same issue in my env. And I've read your comments in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149143/. I didn't review that code too much, for your word "fiddle". I download that patch and test on my env, seems not work for me. And yes, my env is a multi nodes env with DVR enabled, 1 controller and 2 compute nodes.'}, {'account_id': 13667, 'date': '2015-02-13 06:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Oh, I include that wiki is try to explain some background for in DVR case l3agent on compute nodes need a notification of new port. Maybe I expressed in a wrong way.'}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2015-02-13 21:27:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 13:58:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ml2 plugin create_port for notify l3 agent

Method _get_host_port_if_changed in create_port
will return None if host_port not changed.

That will make method _notify_l3_agent_new_port
find nothing need notify to l3 agent. And to
DVR case, l3 agent on compute node will get no
notification, so netns qrouter will not be
created or updated.

If host_port not changed, we should use result
we get from method _create_port_db to notify
l3 agent.

The logic is simple, no need to rewrite UT.

Change-Id: I659c7e1b8a3b0d95657c7edfafff1ca832287b78

'}, {'created': '2015-03-20 13:13:46.000000000', 'message': "rm misuse method _get_host_port_if_changed

Method _get_host_port_if_changed should be only
used on updating action, like update_port, not
creating action, like create_port and create_port_bulk.
But current code will invode _get_host_port_if_changed
both in port updating and creating action. This patch
will fix this.

If a port host binding changed, method
_notify_l3_agent_new_port should be invoked with a port
object as parameter. That's the reason why we need
invoke _get_host_port_if_changed(we need compare rpc
parameters with db updated result to judge whether port
host binding changed), and use it return value as
parameter to invoke an l3 agent notification.
To binding changed case, subnet will be fetched from
port, then processing will fetch related routers and
l3-agents to notify. To binding dischanged case, the
port object, notification method received will be None,
and no notification will do.

The method _get_host_port_if_changed accept two
parameters, one is related to db updated result(mech
_context) and the other is received from compute node
rpc(attrs). To port creating action, no previous db
records exist, so host binding in mech_context should
be same with binding in attrs, so method
 _get_host_port_if_changed will return None. But indeed,
we need notify related l3-agents that new port created,
so directly use db updated result, the mech_context
object, to invoke notification method will make sense.

Cloases-Bug: #1411883

Change-Id: I659c7e1b8a3b0d95657c7edfafff1ca832287b78

commit_message:
rm misuse method _get_host_port_if_changed

Method _get_host_port_if_changed should be only
used on updating action, like update_port, not
creating action, like create_port and create_port_bulk.
But current code will invoke _get_host_port_if_changed
both in port updating and creating action. This patch
will fix this.

If a port host binding changed, method
registry_notifier should be invoked with a port
object as parameter. That's the reason why we need
invoke _get_host_port_if_changed(we need compare rpc
parameters with db updated result to judge whether port
host binding changed), and use its return value as
parameter to invoke an l3 agent notification.
For binding changed case, subnet will be fetched from
port, then processing will fetch related routers and
l3-agents to notify. For binding unchanged case, the
port object, notification method received will be None,
and no notification will do.

The method _get_host_port_if_changed accept two
parameters, one is related to db updated result(mech
_context) and the other is received from compute node
rpc(attrs). For port creating action, no previous db
records exist, so host binding in mech_context should
be same with binding in attrs, so method
 _get_host_port_if_changed will return None. But indeed,
we need notify related l3-agents that new port created,
so directly use db updated result, the mech_context
object, to invoke notification method will make sense.

Change-Id: I659c7e1b8a3b0d95657c7edfafff1ca832287b78

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 22:33:14.000000000', 'message': 'SSP Disk Driver: disconnect_image_disk

Implement disconnect_image_disk in the SSP disk driver.  This removes
the VSCSI mappings for all LUs (of the specified type) from all VIOSes
which are both a) on this host, and b) a member of the Cluster.

The return value is the list of LUs whose mappings were removed.  This
is used as input to the delete_disks method.  We must therefore take
into account that the list of mappings may indicate different sets of
LUs on each VIOS (if, for example, one VIOS was down when a particular
LU was added and mapped).

Verification will fail pending merge of the following from pypowervm:

pypowervm.tasks.scsi_mapper.remove_lu_mapping
Change-Id: Iab28fe072c949d08edb2d407b1e57a3a9f953173

Implement LU.__hash__
Change-Id: I8b04d8b60a427da6624f818cc4d38f27729b8cc2

commit_message:
SSP Disk Driver: disconnect_image_disk

Implement disconnect_image_disk in the SSP disk driver.  This removes
the VSCSI mappings for all LUs (of the specified type) from all VIOSes
which are both a) on this host, and b) a member of the Cluster.

The return value is the list of LUs whose mappings were removed.  This
is used as input to the delete_disks method.  We must therefore take
into account that the list of mappings may indicate different sets of
LUs on each VIOS (if, for example, one VIOS was down when a particular
LU was added and mapped).

Verification will fail pending merge of the following from pypowervm:

pypowervm.tasks.scsi_mapper.remove_lu_mapping
Change-Id: Iab28fe072c949d08edb2d407b1e57a3a9f953173

Implement LU.__hash__
Change-Id: I8b04d8b60a427da6624f818cc4d38f27729b8cc2

We don't have consistent usage of sudo. We have sudo for some docker commands but not for other docker commands. We need to take a careful look at whether we need sudo at all. If the user that Solum will be running as is in sudoers list then ideally there is no need to have sudo."}, {'account_id': 6662, 'date': '2015-04-02 16:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I went through all the docker commands we use, all of them have sudo.  A user in sudoers does not mean the user can access docker w/o sudo, just means the user is able to run command as sudo.'}, {'account_id': 2506, 'date': '2015-04-02 16:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for checking the docker commands.

Good point about ability to run docker commands as sudo. Probably what I meant is that is there a way to run docker commands without requiring sudo? That question does not need to be answered in this patch though.

Update template_validate method description.

Updating the docs to fix the url for restore-stack-from-snapshot
The correct path is:
/v1/​{tenant_id}​/stacks/​{stack_name}​/​{stack_id}​/snapshots/​{snapshot_id}​/restore
original docs were missing the '/restore' portion of the path.

Change-Id: I6e6707721878987f909c22761bc3852856745b26

The correct path is:

original docs were missing the '/restore' portion of the path.

Change-Id: I6e6707721878987f909c22761bc3852856745b26
Closes-Bug: 1411394

commit_message:
Fix restore-stack-from-snapshot path

Updating the docs to fix the url for restore-stack-from-snapshot
The correct path is:
/v1/​{tenant_id}​/stacks/​{stack_name}​/​{stack_id}​/snapshots/​{snapshot_id}​/restore
original docs were missing the '/restore' portion of the path.

Change-Id: I6e6707721878987f909c22761bc3852856745b26
Closes-Bug: 1411394

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 12:34:59.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Do not download Fedora cloud image for heat"

The image also used by sahara, changing the condition to
test sahara availability, otherwise devstack fails with:

 ++ openstack --os-url http://<myhost>:9292 image set
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda --property _sahara_tag_0.1=True --property
_sahara_tag_fake=True --property _sahara_username=fedora
ERROR: openstack No image with a name or ID of
'Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda' exists.

This reverts commit 89983b6dfe15e8e83f390e9870cc3ddfbf2b8243.

Change-Id: Ibc96d8d11bc489536825b445a809eabbba4b7813
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Do not download Fedora cloud image for heat"

The image also used by sahara, changing the condition to
test sahara availability, otherwise devstack fails with:

 ++ openstack --os-url http://<myhost>:9292 image set
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda --property _sahara_tag_0.1=True --property
_sahara_tag_fake=True --property _sahara_username=fedora
ERROR: openstack No image with a name or ID of
'Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda' exists.

This reverts commit 89983b6dfe15e8e83f390e9870cc3ddfbf2b8243.

Change-Id: Ibc96d8d11bc489536825b445a809eabbba4b7813

commit_message:
mock out build_instances/rebuild_instance when not used

Trying to close the gap on what could be causing issues
with races in the conductor tests that hit build/rebuild
instance.

Change-Id: If36ffc21192493c940df9f60beef9476fbd31f84
Partial-Bug: #1434161

commit_message:
Remove auto deletion of routers in unit tests

Remove the automatic deletion behavior of the router
context manager in the L3 unit tests. Any tests that
depend on the router being deleted should do so
explicitly.

It additionally removes the logic from the test_l3_plugin
unit tests that was just related to tearing down enough
stuff to allow the context managers to exit. It was code
that distracted from what the tests were actaully verifying.

All of the context managers for port, network, and subnet
do not auto delete by default and that will be extended to
the L3 constructs as well. The patch that did this for
ports/subnets/networks is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102465/

Change-Id: Iec97198f18e9fc390ff0747b795f7f309c8f3990

fyi, I don't have a lot of experience with the mapr plugin, but here is what I find:

1) The templates load. So far so good

2) When I try to launch a cluster, I consistently see the error below on multiple instances.  I used the image 

https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/sahara-images/ubuntu_trusty_mapr_4.0.2_latest.qcow2

and tagged it for 4.0.2mrv1 in Sahara. I tried both small and large flavors.

Any ideas? Something else I need to set?

commit_message:
VMware: add instance to log messages

A number of log message in vmops.py were not using the instance
as part of the log message. This helps tremendously when debugging.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2b4a2224bf10414f7c3d3981bbf24865b6c457c5

Based on playing, "plugin_version" needs to be "5" instead of "5.0.0" to match the version as reported from the plugin itself.

CLI does not load the plugins to validate versions, in order to avoid extra deps.  Not sure what to do about this.

When I used 5.0.0 I was able to load the templates, but when I tried to launch I got an error from Horizon trying to fetch images.'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-17 19:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

commit_message:
Default templates for Spark

Adding master, slave, and cluster templates for Spark 1.0.0.

Change-Id: Icac3c06328900f892b0f3d554efd07b497a881da
Partially-implements: bp default-templates

commit_message:
Default templates for HDP

Adding master, worker, and cluster templates for supported HDP versions.

Change-Id: I163c6f8cc879f2d2e2f162f604315842b2e5c626
Partially-implements: bp default-templates

commit_message:
Default templates for Vanilla

Adding namenode, secondary, datanode, and cluster templates for
supported Vanilla versions.

Change-Id: I772718bf28e0e06fb77452fc9c1aae9849b4cbe4
Partially-implements: bp default-templates

subject: Add a CLI tool for managing default templates

The README explains how to create one and what the config options are. This isn't linked into the oslo config generator stuff, which is what usually generates the .sample.'}, {'account_id': 10670, 'date': '2015-03-24 16:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-25 19:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Added unit tests for "utils.py", and a single test for the main CLI routines to work out the structure.

It turns out that config options will collide with the CLI options for sahara-db-manage, and multiple subcommand parsers are not allowed by argparse.

Since the logging in this app is a major part of the functionality, and we need to verify log entries in the unit tests, I broke out the "api" from the command line option parsing and allowed "LOG" and "CONF" to be set.  This allows the test code to spoof the logger and the CONF object, which makes things much simpler.'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-25 19:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

More tests to come, meant to say'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-25 19:33:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

(6 comments)

Noted in api.py the few things that actually changed from patch set 23, since the code was moved from cli.py.

So that you do not have to read the whole thing again if you don't want to :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-25 20:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Verified+1

looking good, solid changes Trevor. i think the assertEqual tests should be changed to reflect the test output, so they should be:

    self.assertEqual(expected, observed)'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-26 12:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Before I go and change all of these, we need a clear convention.  From the Python unittest page, there is no assumption in the docs about order for assertEqual itself:

https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

 assertEqual(first, second, msg=None)

In practice, on the doc page there are numerous examples of (actual, expected) (for instance, see the widget.size() examples)

In discussion of assertItemsEqual, the page says this:

 assertItemsEqual(actual, expected, msg=None)

but then in the discussion it says

 "It is the equivalent of assertEqual(sorted(expected), sorted(actual))"

and they flip the order.

So. predominantly, the docs say "actual, expected" but even the docs aren't 100% consistent.  Do we need to be? This comes up a lot in CRs, but equal by definition is equal. Do we really care?'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-26 12:56:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

Do we have a statement somewhere in the Sahara or OpenStack style guides for this? (I'll look).  We probably should, if consistency is something we're after."}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-26 14:21:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

from IRC discussion ...

It's about the testr output, which has messages of the form (expected, observed), so we should match.

We should add a note on this in the Sahara dev style guide"}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-26 18:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 8091, 'date': '2015-03-26 18:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

looking good so far Trevor, very thorough testing too =)

re: tests ordering, i have been digging through the testr and openstack testing docs and i am unable to find a solid reference (much like your research). i think you proposed the best solution, we should just decide which way we want it and then codify in our developer docs. i think it would be great if we could find the reference that shows how the test output is formatting it.'}, {'account_id': 10670, 'date': '2015-03-27 00:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

one more note re: test ordering. i don't think there is any consensus on this among the openstack projects, i've seen several opinions expressed on the mailing list. most notably in this[1] thread. out of which, i think the only thing approaching some sort of evidence is the code for testtools.TestCase.assertEqual[2].

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-November/051189.html
[2]: https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/blob/master/testtools/testcase.py#L342"}, {'account_id': 12038, 'date': '2015-03-28 16:43:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add a CLI tool for managing default templates

This change adds a CLI called sahara-templates to manage default
templates.

Partial-implements: blueprint default-templates
Change-Id: I4f30bd6bc378d90fda41b512c04afe8023d2b4b2

commit_message:
Neutron: simplify validate_networks

Creates a utility method that returns the number of ports required
by an instance. This does the following:
1. it simplifies the method
2. reduce the complexity of the code
'./nova/network/neutronv2/api.py:913:1: C901 'API.validate_networks' is too complex (25)'

NOTE: the code is already tested and this is just moving the internals.

Change-Id: Ibed04a7f10eb85198c7d3ac2cedb58f50ec11f5e

[{'created': '2014-11-25 00:32:37.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Consume the oslo.vmware objects

oslo.vmware now contains the datastore and datacenter objects.

This patch gets rid of the nova datastore object and leverages
oslo.vmware.
Also, changes the API call to download files in order to be able
to bypass vcenter.

Change-Id: I3f1e65dec1500afb58dcb841991ac976887de09d
'}, {'created': '2014-11-25 18:06:34.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Consume the oslo.vmware objects

oslo.vmware now contains the datastore and datacenter objects.

This patch gets rid of the nova datastore object and leverages
oslo.vmware.
Also, changes the API call to download files in order to be able
to bypass vcenter: the operator can specify whether the downloads
from Glance to the datastores are bypassing vCenter which will
improve the performance of the transfer, reduce the load of
vCenter. This new configuration can to be set to True if there is
network connectivity between Nova compute and the ESX hosts.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3f1e65dec1500afb58dcb841991ac976887de09d

commit_message:
VMware: Consume the oslo.vmware objects

oslo.vmware now contains the datastore and datacenter objects.

This patch gets rid of the nova datastore object and leverages
oslo.vmware.

Co-authored-by: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I3f1e65dec1500afb58dcb841991ac976887de09d

Reasons:
- query used in list_database for MySQL datastore uses a
  hard-coded where clause condition to filter schemas,

  to filter schemas, which is based on ignore_dbs.

commit_message:
Corrects list_database query for MySQL

Reasons:
- query used in list_database for MySQL datastore uses a
  hard-coded where clause condition to filter schemas,
  instead of using the values from config variable ignore_dbs.

Changes:
- Removed the hard-coded where condition.
- Updated where clause to use the ignore_dbs.
- Updated unit tests to remove the older where clause matching.

Change-Id: I59738e2874e7fd3801e2b0e90cbbb7035e922bd8
Closes-Bug: #1403822

commit_message:
Add event log API section for DataProcessing API

I would be nice to have example of event log api call.
This patch adds this example.

Change-Id: I72de61a84b238dd320c0a0eb89c41d40f61bd8e4

commit_message:
Adding Secret ACL controller layer changes (Part 3)

Added GET/POST/PATCH/DELETE support for SecretACL operations.
Added unit tests for acls controller.

Added creator_id population logic to get userid from token.

Depends-On: I88aaa3ee686a501062bf46974847fc1f3ea844bf

Change-Id: Ic23d7823d76a4fec015459e39b531e46ea29df79
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 08:25:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix v2.1 list-host to remove 'services' filter

In v2.1, list-host supports 'services' filter also
But this is not case with v2 API. v2 list-host does not support
'services' filter.
v2.1 APIs should be same as v2 in all cases/scenarios.

This is bug fix so not putting as microversions, its just a change to
the v2.1 code so it is equivalent to v2. If later needed then, this can
be reverted back as current ways via microversion.

This was no best test coverage to catch this kind of issue.
This was caught while merging the v2 and v2.1 tests
- Ibd53a7ddd4792942fe2dc45121dcc25fc9864903

Change-Id: I11210babde0c5a668c794cd6aae7eb8c5093a99c
Closes-Bug: #1437184
"}]
commit_message:
Fix v2.1 list-host to remove 'services' filter

In v2.1, list-host supports 'services' filter also
But this is not case with v2 API. v2 list-host does not support
'services' filter.
v2.1 APIs should be same as v2 in all cases/scenarios.

This is bug fix so not putting as microversions, its just a change to
the v2.1 code so it is equivalent to v2. If later needed then, this can
be reverted back as current ways via microversion.

This was no best test coverage to catch this kind of issue.
This was caught while merging the v2 and v2.1 tests
- Ibd53a7ddd4792942fe2dc45121dcc25fc9864903

Change-Id: I11210babde0c5a668c794cd6aae7eb8c5093a99c
Closes-Bug: #1437184

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 11:29:26.000000000', 'message': "Catch more general exception in manager's create_volume

When fixing issues with inaccurate allocated_capacity tracking when
create_volume flow fails (Icd6b04ac60c17cbda225d3be8bcc4435ea0cd7a8)
it was ignored that drivers may raise all kinds of exceptions and these
aren't repacked into CinderException in the flow. This commit broadens
except clause to catch Exception when deciding if rescheduling
occurred while creating a volume. Also regression unit test is added.

Change-Id: I36058eacd1eb6b42c6a4311bd3382ddc9f47550c
Closes-Bug: 1438744
"}]
commit_message:
Catch more general exception in manager's create_volume

When fixing issues with inaccurate allocated_capacity tracking when
create_volume flow fails (Icd6b04ac60c17cbda225d3be8bcc4435ea0cd7a8)
it was ignored that drivers may raise all kinds of exceptions and these
aren't repacked into CinderException in the flow. This commit broadens
except clause to catch Exception when deciding if rescheduling
occurred while creating a volume. Also regression unit test is added.

Change-Id: I36058eacd1eb6b42c6a4311bd3382ddc9f47550c
Closes-Bug: 1438744

commit_message:
Fixes in security_groups.

Fixed exception for orphan "vpc-..."-named groups in describe.
Added check for not deleting default VPC group.
Added check for not deleting VPC if non-default groups exist.
Added check for not allowing creation of groups with existing names.

Change-Id: Ia205ff65409577d148c08b40a297d521d8a8acb1

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>

'}, {'created': '2015-03-17 23:45:54.000000000', 'message': "wip: ec probe test

Tests so far:

- BASIC REBUILD: put object, delete part, run ECrecon, get obj
and confirm etag. Do this for part deleted on one node, 2
adjacent nodes, and 2 nodes that are not partners.

- BASIC REVERT:  kill 2 primaries then PUT an obj so we know
handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

TODO:
- the 'kill' in the revert case currently requires a hack
in utils.ismount() since SAIO for EC has 2 nodes per
server we can't design the test described above using
'kill server'.  Instead, we rename the node dirs (sdbX)
to force a 507 but this requires two things (a) mount_check
must be true (manual now) and (b) utils.ismount() needs
to know that we're on an SAIO so it can check for
existance of a dir to decide if its 'mounted' or not.  This
will need some discussion!

- there is a race in the revert case if we run all ECrecons
at the same time.  Currently if we do and one of the non
handoff ECrecons runs it can repair the FA before the handoff
Ecrecon runs in which case it will 'want' nothing from the
handoff and currently the revert logic will only delete
files if they reverted with success.  So, something needs
to change there

TODO:
- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons
- the hack to utils.ismount if agreed upon (well not so
much a hack as a way to enable SAIO to use mount_check)
- getting the mount_check parm when running probe

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5eefc96ccabda9ec9d2fd91fdee7b6c55f96e966
"}, {'created': '2015-03-18 03:03:01.000000000', 'message': "wip: ec probe test

Tests so far:

- BASIC REBUILD: put object, delete part, run ECrecon, get obj
and confirm etag. Do this for part deleted on one node, 2
adjacent nodes, and 2 nodes that are not partners.

- BASIC REVERT:  kill 2 primaries then PUT an obj so we know
handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

TODO:
- the 'kill' in the revert case currently requires a hack
in utils.ismount() since SAIO for EC has 2 nodes per
server we can't design the test described above using
'kill server'.  Instead, we rename the node dirs (sdbX)
to force a 507 but this requires two things (a) mount_check
must be true (manual now) and (b) utils.ismount() needs
to know that we're on an SAIO so it can check for
existance of a dir to decide if its 'mounted' or not.  This
will need some discussion!

- there is a race in the revert case if we run all ECrecons
at the same time.  Currently if we do and one of the non
handoff ECrecons runs it can repair the FA before the handoff
Ecrecon runs in which case it will 'want' nothing from the
handoff and currently the revert logic will only delete
files if they reverted with success.  So, something needs
to change there

- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons
- getting the mount_check parm when running probe

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5eefc96ccabda9ec9d2fd91fdee7b6c55f96e966

handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

- BASIC DELETE REVERT:  test to make sure deletes are
propogated

TODO:
- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons

commit_message:
EC Reconstructor Probe Tests

- BASIC REBUILD: put object, delete part, run ECrecon, get obj
and confirm etag. Do this for part deleted on one node, 2
adjacent nodes, and 2 nodes that are not partners.

- BASIC REVERT:  kill 2 primaries then PUT an obj so we know
handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

- BASIC DELETE REVERT:  test to make sure deletes are
propogated

More ideas:
- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5eefc96ccabda9ec9d2fd91fdee7b6c55f96e966

commit_message:
Make sure COPY requests are routed correctly

This change makes sure COPY requests are routed through the correct
controller instance type for the policy. And really all Clay, we
found the issue and wrote a gist.. I'm just throwing it up as a
patch, so it's in the system.

Change-Id: I68cfa30c4fcf3bcfb74a7a7614f083b0bd6a40a3
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2015-03-30 19:18:39.000000000', 'message': "WIP: EC specific ssync_sender fixes and tests

Fix some of the EC specific handling in ssync_sender
and add unit tests to cover:

- when deleting sync_revert fragments that have been
sent to receiver, do not delete the durable file.

WIP because there's more to do!

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d
"}, {'created': '2015-03-31 00:17:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix ssync sender cleanup of reverted fragment files

With EC ssync may send a specific fragment archive index to
the receiver (a 'revert') and then remove that fragment archive
from the sender node. If that fragment archive is the only one
on the local node then any .durable file for same timestamp
should also be removed, otherwise the .durable should be left
in place.

Adds a purge() method to ECDiskFile which ssync_sender can call
to remove an archive file form disk. This encapsulates the EC
specific behavior in the ECDiskFile class.

Adds ssync_sender and diskfile unit tests.

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d

"}, {'created': '2015-04-01 18:09:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix ssync sender behavior for EC reconstructor jobs

Fixes to ssync with EC:

- With EC ssync may send a specific fragment archive index to
  the receiver (a 'revert') and then remove that fragment archive
  from the sender node. If that fragment archive is the only one
  on the local node then any .durable file for same timestamp
  should also be removed, otherwise the .durable should be left
  in place.

- Adds a purge() method to ECDiskFile which ssync_sender can call
  to remove an archive file from disk. This encapsulates the EC
  specific behavior in the ECDiskFile class.

- Change reconstruct_fa() to raise a DiskFileError if it fails
  to build a diskfile-like-thing.

- ssync continues to make progress if an fragment archive can't
  be built.

- Adds ssync_sender and diskfile unit tests.

- Adds end-to-end ssync test for EC ssync_revert and sync_only
 jobs.

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d

commit_message:
Fix ssync sender behavior for EC reconstructor jobs

Fixes to ssync with EC:

- With EC ssync may send a specific fragment archive index to
  the receiver (a 'revert') and then remove that fragment archive
  from the sender node. If that fragment archive is the only one
  on the local node then any .durable file for same timestamp
  should also be removed, otherwise the .durable should be left
  in place.

- Adds a purge() method to ECDiskFile which ssync_sender can call
  to remove an archive file from disk. This encapsulates the EC
  specific behavior in the ECDiskFile class.

- Change reconstruct_fa() to raise a DiskFileError if it fails
  to build a diskfile-like-thing.

- ssync continues to make progress if an fragment archive can't
  be built.

- Adds ssync_sender and diskfile unit tests.

- Adds end-to-end ssync test for EC ssync_revert and sync_only
 jobs.

- enable easier upgrades to missing_check protocol phase by
  making sender and receiver parsing of missing check lines
  less brittle. This could prove useful for detecting when
  receiver only needs a .durable file for existing .data file.

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d

commit_message:
No IPv6 SLAAC addrs for create router intf without fixed_ips

Consider the following sequence:
- Create a neutron network
- Create multiple subnets on the network, including one or more IPv6 SLAAC
  subnets
- Create a router port on the network without specifying fixed_ips

The port created in this case is incorrectly getting associated with
addresses from the SLAAC subnet(s). This patch corrects this
behavior.

Change-Id: Ic0ab2294c5487f85baade8f879946dfe738d109b
Closes-Bug: 1432270

commit_message:
Dont create notification with hook data from astute

By convention error message, and error details that are sent
by astute is separated by \n\n.

In case of error message for tasks it is fine, but for notification
its creates a lot of clutter.

Change-Id: I221b6a759d4735ce008e1f2cfeb73c1598b5b089
Closes-Bug: 1432751

commit_message:
Glance cache to not prune newly cached images

Sqlite driver doesn't set the last accessed time when an image is
first added to cache. This makes the newly cached images susceptible
to pruning first instead of older images.

Change-Id: I46973a921c7cfb42811c58383e1b7a4004e70f27
Closes-bug: #1438564

Update devstack log publisher to use new macro

A new macro for capturing all of devstack's logs, the console log and
documentation has been added so we should use that.

I may be missing something -- don't we still have apache handling the header/footer for things served from the static.o.o filesystem?"}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-03-26 23:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hey James,

Yes, static.o.o serves the documentation as apache help footers for logs that are still being uploaded via scp. For swift logs we need to upload a copy alongside the results for zuul-swift-upload to append to the indexes it generates.

So apache will only continue to handle the files until we move everything over to swift. The documentation in devstack-gate will be the central place. It is currently being pulled into static.o.o and also here into the jobs.

Cheers,
Josh'}, {'account_id': 6987, 'date': '2015-03-27 16:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2015-04-01 20:52:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks.  However, I _think_ Ifcc7b9ab40aad55bc45377183ea06d40d9fe2f78 means that this is not necessary for SCP files, because apache will continue to serve what's in devstack-gate for them.

Of course we still need to upload the ones for swift."}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-04-02 00:51:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

You're spot on. We will still need to upload them for swift ones. That's exactly what this job is for."}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2015-04-02 00:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2015-04-02 01:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-02 01:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Upload devstack-gate documentation with logs

We need to place the tempest log documentation in with the devstack
logs. We can do this as a publisher shell step.

The tempest overview is a little more complicated as it needs
placing in the top most job results directory. We can scp this for
the old log storage and then for zuul-swift-logs we pass it as a
file to be uploaded which will hence be in the master index (ie at
the top of our pseudo filesystem)

Change-Id: I54d2d2ba9b6532221ca3b376ab2e51bc5398444e

commit_message:
Adding ACL db repository changes (Part 2)

Added repositories for SecretACL and ContainerACL entities.

There is no repository logic added for ACL user tables as its data
is accessed via relationship defined in respective ACL tables.
Currently ACL logic does not require separate APIs for these entities.

Depends-On: Iffe63e865fd98eb9393a9d87f7921909dc48e4e1

Change-Id: I88aaa3ee686a501062bf46974847fc1f3ea844bf
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

commit_message:
Added csv output format

I have added the csv output format (-f csv). The csv data is written
to bandit_results.csv unless another filename is provided using the
-o flag. csv data does not include any code output, as this cannot
be formatted in a way to be of any use in a spreadsheet.

Change-Id: Ia2f9ee7da08a5a8e610763a528c1e21621e6d28a

commit_message:
Add global limits to V2 limits endpoint

This allows API users to determine the various arbitrary
operator defined limits like max page size, max domain
name length etc

Change-Id: Idb63823f4abbade44cb5bf89334c0056fcabff46

commit_message:
Fix min_ttl config to be an IntOpt

min_ttl was incorrectly defined as a StrOpt, rather than
and IntOpt.

Change-Id: I9d8769cd9bcd4d7f81e9a3014060090e2cf683c3

commit_message:
Implement default and max page size for V2 API

Default to 20 items per page, with support for changing the default value, and
support for showing "max" results at once, whichd defaults to 1000 results.

Change-Id: Id358f50a696c848b59b1f339c6e0cb4817dc9c9f
Partial-Bug: 1434479
Closes-Bug: 1439457

commit_message:
Fix cwd path for plugin tasks

For all plugin cwd of the last plugin
in the list was set, the patch uses
plugin specific cwd path.

Change-Id: Ibda17ff02f1dbb9fcf638b2b2696a9c1d83d3100
Closes-bug: #1438649

commit_message:
Remove fuel_update_downloader from the repository

The development started a year ago, since then
there are no updates of plans. The code is not
finished and outdated, hence it's just removing
of unused code.

Change-Id: I385d12f6161a03b43ab820821141f07e6b1365b9
Related-bug: #1434106

commit_message:
Validate plan and lp names in app and lp create

In app create, I've added a check for plan name
against a regex to prevent sending bad names to
Solum and getting a 500 response.

Same story for languagepack names.

Change-Id: I408267ad10fca1faf920c00d093d8f85bfa7a8a2

Thanks a lot Irina, looks good for me.'}, {'account_id': 10667, 'date': '2015-03-12 11:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Hi,
1. The simplest way for additional intramfs is using cpio archive. Just
mkdir -p ./dd-src/lib/modules/2.6.32-504.1.3.el6.x86_64/kernel/drivers/scsi
cp hpvsa.ko .... ; cd dd-src
find . cpio --quiet -o -H newc | gzip -9 > ../initrd_update.img
2. You forget about "depmod" in both cases "additional img" and "modifying bootstrap"
3. - echo hpvsa >> etc/modules
   + echo hpvsa >> etc/modules.conf
etc/modules is ubuntu specific. And I think both don't work without "depmod".'}, {'account_id': 13082, 'date': '2015-03-16 07:19:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Evgeny, I need a clarification for that:
1) are u speaking about creating a custom intramfs?or about using initrd_update?
2) does your case mean that we don't need to create a custom bootstrap?

Thx for the answers"}, {'account_id': 13082, 'date': '2015-03-16 07:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Adding Andrew W for review'}, {'account_id': 10667, 'date': '2015-03-17 12:05:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

"}, {'created': '2015-03-12 07:22:29.000000000', 'message': 'Adds instructions on custom bootstrap node into dev docs

Since this information is not reflected in
the dev documentation and is requested by different
developers, let's update our current doc with it.
The following topics will be covered:

* how to create an additional
  "piece" of bootstrap (initrd_update)
  that will be injected into the
  original initramfs image on the bootstrap.
  That means, avoid modifying the original initramfs
  image for bootstrap

* how to modify the original initramfs image manually

* hot to create a custom initramfs image for
  bootstrap to replace the default one

Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Kozkukalov <vkozhukalov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Albert Syriy <asyriy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I6238395e92dc3f0381548c12a15d5619fc5b7411
Closes-Bug: 1428160

commit_message:
Adds instructions on custom bootstrap node into dev docs

Since this information is not reflected in
the dev documentation and is requested by different
developers, let's update our current doc with it.
The following topics will be covered:

* how to create an additional
  "piece" of bootstrap (initrd_update)
  that will be injected into the
  original initramfs image on the bootstrap.
  That means, avoid modifying the original initramfs
  image for bootstrap

* how to modify the original initramfs image manually

* hot to create a custom initramfs image for
  bootstrap to replace the default one

Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Kozkukalov <vkozhukalov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Albert Syriy <asyriy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I6238395e92dc3f0381548c12a15d5619fc5b7411
Closes-Bug: 1428160
