subject: IBP: fix apt pinning in build script
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8907, 'name': 'Dmitry Shulyak', 'email': 'dshulyak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dshulyak'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10474, 'name': 'Vitaly Parakhin', 'email': 'vparakhin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'brain461'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}, {'_account_id': 13445, 'name': 'Przemyslaw Kaminski', 'email': 'pkaminski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'PK'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-23 10:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-23 10:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/74/166774/1/check/noop/0e7e60f/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 10391, 'date': '2015-03-23 11:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-23 14:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-23 14:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/74/166774/2/check/noop/253ad29/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 13194, 'date': '2015-03-23 15:52:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please explain why is it necessary to pin by the archive name ('a') rather than the distribution codename ('n')"}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:08:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The reason is very simple. Pinning is very tricky and isn't well documented so, in order to keep it working for our cases, we need to do that all magic. Even if it was discovered under trial and error routine."}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:18:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Eg. even if manual says, 'you can have multiple Pin stanzas' it doesn't mean that all stanzas will be applied and processed somehow. It just use the first one or the last one. That is the reason of why we can't combine all stanzas together.

Initially we think that something like

Package: *

Pin: origin 10.20.0.2

Pin: release n=trusty

Pin: release c=main,c=universe

Pin-Priority: 1001

will work. But in fact, it applies only the last stanzas in case of multiple ones. So, only 

Package: *

Pin: release c=universe

Pin-Priority: 1001

will be applied."}, {'account_id': 10391, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Aleksans, I think you can reuse my commit message:

We have to use `archive` name in APT pinning because `suite` is actually
an archive name. For instance, the following upstream Ubuntu repo
    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty-updates main
has the following attributes in APT pinning
    a=trusty-updates, n=trusty, c=main
Obviously, it's wrong to use `n=` (codename) for matching suite.
Besides this, since now we're generating a few pinnings for the source
like
    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty main restricted
because the following line
    a=trusty, c=main, c=restricted
will apply pinning only for the `restricted` section."}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-23 16:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/74/166774/3/check/noop/dc534da/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 10391, 'date': '2015-03-24 09:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Works as expected, tested on iso.'}, {'account_id': 3009, 'date': '2015-03-24 10:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-24 10:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-24 10:44:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/74/166774/4/check/noop/e66b9c6/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 13194, 'date': '2015-03-24 11:38:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

> Pinning is very tricky and isn't well documented so,

This statement is blatantly wrong.

> in order to keep it working for our cases, we need to do that all magic.

Please stop cargo cult coding, instead read the docs:

https://wiki.debian.org/RepositoryFormat
http://linux.die.net/man/5/apt_preferences
 
and take a look at the actual APT repo metadata:

http://ru.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/trusty/main/binary-amd64/Release"}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-24 12:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3009, 'date': '2015-03-24 13:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2015-03-24 13:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13194, 'date': '2015-03-24 13:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10474, 'date': '2015-03-24 17:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2015-03-24 23:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-31 10:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-31 10:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/74/166774/5/check/noop/3a9ca8a/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 13194, 'date': '2015-03-31 11:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The current implementation fails to address a basic use case, that is, installing a package from a 3rd party repository.

Say, a user would like to install ceph from http://ceph.com/debian-firefly (no matter what its version is)
and adds Inktank APT repo

 deb http://ceph.com/debian-firefly trusty main

with a priority 1100.

The pinning rules produced by the current code (with this patch applied) are

 Package: *
 Pin: a=trusty, c=main
 Pin-Priority: 1100

These rules match *both* ceph packages from Canonical repo (http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu trusty main) and from Inktank one (http://ceph.com/debian-firefly trusty main).
As a result the newest package will be installed, which is not what the user wants.
In fact installing the newest available version of a package is a default behavior, it does not require any pinning at all.


The correct approach is to make use of the APT repo metadata (Origin, Label, Codename, etc) in the pinning rules.
For instance for the above mentioned Inktank repo the following rules should be produced:

 Package: *
 Pin: release o=Inktank, n=trusty
 Pin-Priority: 1100'}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-31 11:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-31 11:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/74/166774/6/check/noop/f967fcf/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 13445, 'date': '2015-03-31 12:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3009, 'date': '2015-03-31 12:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Proper pinning using real mirror metadata is supposed to be implemented later (Fuel 7.0). However, this implementation covers our basic use case.'}, {'account_id': 10391, 'date': '2015-03-31 13:00:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

i think we should run ubuntu bvt in order to make it doesn't break anything."}, {'account_id': 13194, 'date': '2015-03-31 13:50:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Installing a package from a 3rd party APT repo (i.e. installing ceph from deb http://ceph.com/debian-firefly trusty main) is a basic feature.

If you believe it's OK to release a code which doesn't implement it, go ahead. However I thought we had a higher code quality standards."}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-31 14:06:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Alexei Sheplyakov, looks like nobody from here knows how to use 'origin' combined with other 'Pin' stanzas. In other words, pinning is still tricky and isn't well documented"}, {'account_id': 8003, 'date': '2015-03-31 16:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

"}, {'created': '2015-03-23 16:58:49.000000000', 'message': "IBP: fix apt pinning in build script

We have to use `archive` name in APT pinning because `suite` is actually
an archive name. For instance, the following upstream Ubuntu repo

    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty-updates main

has the following attributes in APT pinning

    a=trusty-updates, n=trusty, c=main

Obviously, it's wrong to use `n=` (codename) for matching suite.

Besides this, since now we're generating a few pinnings for the source
like

    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty main restricted

because the following line

    a=trusty, c=main, c=restricted

will apply pinning only for the `restricted` section.

commit_message:
IBP: fix apt pinning in build script

We have to use `archive` name in APT pinning because `suite` is actually
an archive name. For instance, the following upstream Ubuntu repo

    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty-updates main

has the following attributes in APT pinning

    a=trusty-updates, n=trusty, c=main

Obviously, it's wrong to use `n=` (codename) for matching suite.

Besides this, since now we're generating a few pinnings for the source
like

    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty main restricted

because the following line

    a=trusty, c=main, c=restricted

will apply pinning only for the `restricted` section.

Also, it skips a repo from pinning if its priority isn't set.

Change-Id: Ibe5c99910f70312ea4e4bd0c642cd8f31ddc526b
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
Closes-Bug: #1436806

commit_message:
Fix fuel-image

* Use advanced loop device management. It chooses the last available
unused loop device, otherwise it will create a new one with the
higher MINOR number.

* Use random temporary directory to build images.

Combined together, these abilities allow to run simultaneous builds.

Change-Id: Ib9a8ccfbe97fe3f660269526fe9b75cb3d185369
Closes-Bug: #1436423

commit_message:
Add the output from pygmentize

Currently, the tango pygments_style theme is set to tango,
but there was no output from

pygmentize -S tango -f html

Which is required to create the css file.

Tango is does not render nicely, so this patch also switches to the
native theme, which is readable.

Change-Id: Ie69486ba7269d2f4b4adb6d17bb205c2f7cd0161
Closes-bug: #1439523

commit_message:
Fixes monasca collector erroring out

This patch fixes monasca collector erroring out when init_config
is None in detection plugin.

Change-Id: Id44b1ca651d6cd531c8f9cedcfd53a26f231667c
Closes-Bug: #1439501

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-24 07:51:02.000000000', 'message': 'Improve setting of libvirt rbd secret

Check if the value of the secret key is up to date instead if checking for the existence of the key.
In the current implementation the libvirt key is not updated when the value of the key changes.
This change ensures the key is set to the current value.

Change-Id: Iaccca8797e491e92dd682c521178f9b7e11398ac

commit_message:
Improve setting of libvirt rbd secret

Check if the value of the secret key is up to date instead of checking for the existence of the key.
In the current implementation the libvirt key is not updated when the value of the key changes.
This change ensures the key is set to the current value.

Change-Id: Iaccca8797e491e92dd682c521178f9b7e11398ac

Some bugs were fixed in previous commits with how data is presented at /
and /v1/resource but the xfail-ing tests in resource.yaml didn't get
fixed up because they were still failing (instead of becoming unexpected
success) because of the structure of the tests. We'll want to keep this
in mind when creating future xfails.

Change-Id: I7e301d3a97099480edd4ed13709c5865cd8b4929
"}]
commit_message:
Update resource.yaml to reflect recent fixes

Some bugs were fixed in previous commits with how data is presented at /
and /v1/resource but the xfail-ing tests in resource.yaml didn't get
fixed up because they were still failing (instead of becoming unexpected
success) because of the structure of the tests. We'll want to keep this
in mind when creating future xfails.

Change-Id: I7e301d3a97099480edd4ed13709c5865cd8b4929

commit_message:
Updating Orders functional tests to new naming convention

Simple code refactor that updates the smoke test to use deepcopy
and renames all orders tests.

Change-Id: Idc2c28d1f9f12882c9f103619d0ddabc03528888

commit_message:
Fix docs nit - make it clear the arg is a string

jeblair made a good point in a previous review, there is a string
argument that the docs for made it look like you'd pass in a class.

Change-Id: Icc9449f75165a3ef8d9920b68eb23c830f8198f0

cluster_type was not handled in backend, backend is now using config to handle cluster_type, seems we should update back first?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2015-03-17 15:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agree. Should mark this as WIP until the backup is supported.'}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2015-03-17 16:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12385, 'date': '2015-03-18 00:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

agree with Jay'}, {'account_id': 8580, 'date': '2015-03-18 10:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Added backend support for this - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165346/'}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2015-03-18 17:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Diga,

Have you considered making a revision to this patch such that it depends on 165346? If you need tops on how to do this, list us know, and we can provide guidance. That way we can approve this work for merge, and it will go in once 165346 merges.

I like this approach because it allows us to review parts of related code in smaller chunks, and the relations between them become much more clear (not keeping them in mind based on reading the comment stream, but using a systemic approach).

Thanks,

Adrian'}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2015-03-20 23:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Gentle nudge to check if this is still on your radar, @diga'}, {'account_id': 8580, 'date': '2015-03-21 18:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes Adrian. I am working on this. This patch is dependant on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/165346/. But getting some problem in test cases so I am working on that.'}, {'account_id': 8580, 'date': '2015-03-23 08:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Allow specification of cluster-type.

Pass cluster-type to magnum baymodel if specified.

Change-Id: Idaa78c9bb1b9f20140888b3797d97653fe4793ca
Closes-bug: #1432967

commit_message:
Add application actions sorting

When list of actions is browsed, it's not ordered in any way.
To provide more usability, need to sort it alphabetically

Change-Id: Ie6f546f9016cdf19aa8ae5e82504ee7c9d33a387
Closes-Bug: #1438161

IMO the way things are being tested for this CR are not very descriptive, and it just makes the reader spend more time figuring out the tests. commit_message:
Create snakeoil certificate plugin

This plugin is very useful for dev/testing setups (and Octavia).

Implements: blueprint barbican-snakeoil-ca

Co-authored-by: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I15f2ef8559ee5b95c8eef4eeb42edda68859e003

commit_message:
Adds endpoint to --fromenv deployment creation

Will read os-endpoint from environment variables.
Fixes some typos in related docstring as well.

Change-Id: I853a181130b7da885392211515784bdf93249774

commit_message:
puppet_debug added into cluster attributes

After merging patch, that was checked by CI and Jenkins
before cluster structure checking was introduced our test
became broken.

Closes-Bug: #1439732

commit_message:
Adding ACL db model changes (Part 1)

Split db layer changes into two parts (model and repositories).

Moving user ids from ACL tables to respective user tables i.e.
SecretACLUser and ContainerACLUser tables.

Removed soft delete mixin for ACL and ACL user tables. And now
adding unique constraint on these tables.

Adding new ACL and ACL user tables and modified migration scripts.
Added new creator_id support in secret, container and order
entity.

Change-Id: Iffe63e865fd98eb9393a9d87f7921909dc48e4e1
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

Changeset I49255255 has added an 'is_base' attribute for Image Schema
properties, thus allowing to differentiate between base and custom image
properties, but the client hasn't make any use of it.

This patch adds appropriate attribute to SchemaProperty class and a
helper method which allows to validate if the given property is base or
not.

The added helper method (is_base_property) should not be confused with
the existing is_core_property: the latter just checks if the property is
known to the schema, regardless of its being base or not.

commit_message:
Expose 'is_base' schema property attribute

Changeset I49255255 has added an 'is_base' attribute for Image Schema
properties, thus allowing to differentiate between base and custom image
properties, but the client hasn't make any use of it.

This patch adds appropriate attribute to SchemaProperty class and a
helper method which allows to validate if the given property is base or
not.

The added helper method (is_base_property) should not be confused with
the existing is_core_property: the latter just checks if the property is
known to the schema, regardless of its being base or not.

Change-Id: I7c397196dad9ae5494ed2f8f3aacef3fc1ce70d8
Partial-Bug: #1323660

commit_message:
Introducing docker changes to openstack-compute


This includes cookbook-openstack-compute changes required to enable
nova-docker driver as a compute driver and allow user to configure a
compute as docker compute

Implements: blueprint docker-driver-configuration

Change-Id: I6fa7e93a4050419fb0531e17b56da4c32205bce3

[{'account_id': 15356, 'date': '2015-03-04 15:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2015-03-04 15:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 15356, 'date': '2015-03-04 15:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Description taken from https://bugs.launchpad.net/barbican/+bug/1428183

In a brand new Ubuntu Server 14.04.2 installation:

0) prepare workstation as instructed in the quick start guide [1]
1) clone https://github.com/openstack/barbican.git
2) switch to its directory and run ./bin/barbican.sh install
3) barbican is installed, but tests fail.

[1] https://github.com/cloudkeep/barbican/wiki/Barbican-Quick-Start-Guide

<snip>

Successfully installed barbican
Cleaning up...
running testr
running=OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE=${OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE:-1} \
OS_STDERR_CAPTURE=${OS_STDERR_CAPTURE:-1} \
${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover -s ./barbican -t .
======================================================================
FAIL: barbican.tests.queue.test_keystone_listener.WhenUsingMessageServer.test_keystone_notification_config_used
tags: worker-0
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "barbican/tests/queue/test_keystone_listener.py", line 268, in setUp
    queue.init(self.conf)
  File "barbican/queue/__init__.py", line 108, in init
    TRANSPORT = messaging.get_transport(conf, allowed_remote_exmods=exmods)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/transport.py", line 186, in get_transport
    invoke_kwds=kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/stevedore/driver.py", line 45, in __init__
    verify_requirements=verify_requirements,
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/stevedore/named.py", line 55, in __init__
    verify_requirements)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/stevedore/extension.py", line 170, in _load_plugins
    self._on_load_failure_callback(self, ep, err)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/stevedore/driver.py", line 50, in _default_on_load_failure
    raise err
ImportError: No module named anyjson
Traceback (most recent call last):
_StringException: Empty attachments:
  stderr
  stdout

</snip>

This message is shown since anyjson was not installed (missing in test-requirements.txt).
There are 4 missing dependencies:
1) webtest
2) greenlet
3) amqp
4) anyjson'}, {'account_id': 15356, 'date': '2015-03-04 16:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2015-03-04 19:27:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

actually, there shouldn't be a dependency with anyjson. That should have been handled with the oslo implementation of json, which is in oslo.serialization if I remember correctly. commit_message:
Fuel plugin install --force now can install new plugin

Without this changes fuel return error if you will
try to install new plugin using install with --force

Change-Id: Id3b2966f78bf24bb47f05b7d0a02bb101b7843b5
Closes-Bug: #1439128

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 12:18:04.000000000', 'message': "Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

merged from Ifb5cb05b9cc2b8758d5a8e34f7792470a73d7c40

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of length-2 sequences, these are benefits copied
from [1]:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.
Nova dropped python 2.6 support, we can leverage this now.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwagrs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/154798/

Change-Id: I1bc53e335b6c291da5c54f067f9fdfd5da6b2902

commit_message:
Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

merged from Ifb5cb05b9cc2b8758d5a8e34f7792470a73d7c40

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of length-2 sequences, these are benefits copied
from [1]:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.
Nova dropped python 2.6 support, we can leverage this now.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwagrs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/154798/

Change-Id: I1bc53e335b6c291da5c54f067f9fdfd5da6b2902

commit_message:
remove stale pyc before tests

Stale pyc files can create massive confusion on failing
tests. Extremely hard to debug. Remove all pyc files before we run
tests.

Change-Id: I67da587382af87389c2d04c23d84f13f341a1e46
Related-Bug: #1401600

commit_message:
Security tests for Container resources

These tests will attempt CRUD operations on Container resources, both
with and without (dummy) project ids, and always without valid tokens.
They should all return HTTP 401s. Fixed block comment formatting for
PEP8. Added tests to ContainersUnauthedTestCase class, tagged with
security and negative attributes.

Change-Id: I2952f06f8e9141028a606a587e07a07b5d9358c2

[{'created': '2015-04-02 08:11:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't output file content in log

when the number of ports in a network is large, outputing the file
content in log is expensive.

Change-Id: Ia634792064ee9832f20cd79d22c1b6b9483d2cac
"}]
commit_message:
Don't output file content in log

when the number of ports in a network is large, outputing the file
content in log is expensive.

Change-Id: Ia634792064ee9832f20cd79d22c1b6b9483d2cac

commit_message:
Poll on the actual image showing up

Turns out just polling on the task completion doesn't mean you actually
have the image. You also need to poll on the image becoming a thing in
glance.

Change-Id: I910ac612e6af1f5888c1820a09ee79fab012bdae

commit_message:
Add delete_image call

Lo and behold! Deleting images works differently between glance v1 and
v2. Of course it does.

Change-Id: I9eb97950507d95076342ef3cb56205ff505f7fae

commit_message:
Add comment for nbctl current implementation

nbctl current implementation doesnt support transactions and
the current implementation mislead regarding that.

Change-Id: I5eec93375b033f21f824e1ed6d4e3696d7d3a23b

subject: Update sahara-image-elements according with fix dib-lint errors
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}, {'_account_id': 12320, 'name': 'Pino Toscano', 'email': 'ptoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ptoscano'}, {'_account_id': 13919, 'name': 'Evgeny Sikachev', 'email': 'esikachov@gmail.com', 'username': 'esikachev'}, {'_account_id': 13953, 'name': 'Elise Gafford', 'email': 'egafford@redhat.com', 'username': 'egafford'}, {'_account_id': 14981, 'name': 'Mikhail Ivanov', 'email': 'mivanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mivanov'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Work in progress'}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-sahara-image-elements-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/38/169738/3/check/gate-sahara-image-elements-pep8/3a31a5d/ : SUCCESS in 25s
- check-sahara-buildimages-vanilla http://logs.openstack.org/38/169738/3/check/check-sahara-buildimages-vanilla/1f910c2/ : FAILURE in 1m 14s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:49:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Actually, I was working on that too... and your work has less changes than the actual dib-lint errors.

Also, this big commit is a no-go, as changes should be done by topics.

I just pushed few change requests I've been testing yesterday, and they either fix few errors or help fixing more later:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169749/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169754/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169755/"}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

As said also in the previous comment.'}, {'account_id': 13953, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:57:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Mikhail, thanks for helping to clean up these elements! Much appreciated.

As Pino mentions, huge commits are sometimes necessary (almost always when there's a new feature that can't meaningfully be added in pieces,) but it might be best to break this down a bit (especially as Pino's been working on many of these changes in parallel.) Maybe do a review per element?"}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-sahara-image-elements-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/38/169738/4/check/gate-sahara-image-elements-pep8/54d99b0/ : SUCCESS in 19s
- check-sahara-buildimages-vanilla http://logs.openstack.org/38/169738/4/check/check-sahara-buildimages-vanilla/0428a3b/ : FAILURE in 27s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

So, to expand a bit more on this big change request and the changes it brings.

There are different dib-lint errors, and as such they need different fixes:

- set -e/pipefail
This is something I'd really love to have, as it can easily handle failing commands without letting them slip unnoticed.
However, there are few issues that prevent this to happen, namely:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167747/ -- a couple of scripts need to be bash, as "set -o pipefail" is bash-specific
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167992/ -- the current rpm -U command will fail if epel-release is installed already, so use the epel element to handle this situation
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169749/ -- the environment.d scripts don't need to have the extra flags set (at least, most of those in dib haven't them either), as they are just sourced and all they do is an export

- set -u
This is mostly covered by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169755/

- sorting of element-deps files
This is a good candidate for being done in an own change request, and I'd +1 it

- 00-java-rc not executable
Convered by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169754/

- elements/mysql/install.d/start-mysql.sh and elements/hadoop/post-install.d/firstboot
Those are not dib element scripts, so for now they should be ignored, or change/adapt them (still not breaking them) so dib-lint is happier with them. Ideally, they should be handled in separate change requests.

Furthermore, a general note: please be a lot more verbose on what a change is for, and especially on big changes like this also on the various proposed changes. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages can be a very helpful guide on this.'}, {'account_id': 10670, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

agreed with Ethan and Pino, i think this patch should be re-examined and perhaps reduced in scale.'}, {'account_id': 13919, 'date': '2015-04-01 15:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

agreed with Pino (see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages)'}, {'account_id': 13919, 'date': '2015-04-02 12:39:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

please, add "Closes-bug"'}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-02 12:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Evgeny Sikachev:
> please, add "Closes-bug"

the proposed patch does fix all the dib-lint issues, unfortunately...'}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-02 12:53:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

... does *not* fix, I meant...'}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-02 13:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Dear Pino!
I'm sorry about my early changeset. This patch should be fix for small dib-lint errors, like "$FILENAME is not set $VARIABLE". This errors was fixed, but unbound variables was not fixed at all. This means that I depends on your https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169755/ patch. 
Also, I'm sorry that this patch include a lot of files.
About elements/mysql/install.d/mysql-start.sh and elements/hadoop/post-install.d/firstboot. In this files I added one string, that disable dib-lint checking for this files. 
I'm continue to work on this patch, and my work in progress.
Thank you for your understanding and patience.'}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-02 14:07:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Mikhail!

no worries about the big changeset, making mistakes can happen (and I do lots of them too ;) ).

I see you want to continue fixing dib-lint issues, which is great! I'd like to offer you a couple of personal suggestions on how to go forward with it, in different change requests:
* sort element-deps files
* Make sure that elements/mysql/install.d/mysql-start.sh and elements/hadoop/post-install.d/firstboot do not trigger any dib-lint error; this could need to fix/improve dib-lint itself, see https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1436485 for example

Regarding the set -e/u/pipefail: I've been developing and testing this patch for a couple of weeks now, that's why I sent other change requests for issues found in the process. I'd like to send it when all the issues are fixed, if you agree.

Regarding this merge request: IMHO it is contains too many unrelated stuff, and partially overlapping with other merge requests. What do you think about discarding it and opening new ones targeted on the specific topics, like suggested above?"}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-02 14:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Pino,

This change is working on a bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1435306, and I will change my next commit message according with rules.

* element-deps file was sorted,
* and elements/mysql/install.d/mysql-start.sh and elements/hadoop/post-install.d/firstboot do not trigger any dib-lint error. You can see it in http://logs.openstack.org/38/169738/4/check/gate-sahara-image-elements-pep8/54d99b0/console.html

Maybe I can wait for merging your changes, and after that I will rebase this change set?'}, {'account_id': 12320, 'date': '2015-04-02 15:04:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Even if you fixed all the issues (which according to tests your patch does not yet, though), they should be done in different change requests.  This helps reviewing and debugging them.

I know you are working on https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1435306 (I'm subscribed to it), and you can see there I started fixing dib-lint issues a couple of weeks ago."}, {'account_id': 14981, 'date': '2015-04-02 15:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Replace python webserver with apache in container

Apache can serve repo requests better than the simple
HTTP server, plus docker can dynamically allocate a random
host port far more effectively than randomly selecting one.

This patch offers better stability when building Fuel.

Change-Id: I83efa2b5100663b3de117e15c0eea47288842953
Closes-Bug: #1421610

commit_message:
Skip passing in timeout to glance if it's not set

glanceclient wants to do a float type validation, which is laudable.
However, it means we can't pass in timeout=None, and instead have to
avoid passing in the parameter if we do not have it set.

Change-Id: Ie6e144d6e3cedf5bf8846beefcfda0f3252377e6

[{'created': '2015-03-23 13:26:47.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid load real policy from policy.d when using fake policy fixture

The v2.1 API policy rules separated into a file in policy.d. But the
fake policy fixture didn't override the default policy_dirs config,
that leads to fake policy fixture will load real policy config from
"/etc/nova/policy.d" and unittest will failed.

This patch override default policy_dirs value to empty list.

Change-Id: I7d8958dc2f0bb927b98b2bb86c99e855db6c5e2e
Closes-Bug: #1435327
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid load real policy from policy.d when using fake policy fixture

The v2.1 API policy rules separated into a file in policy.d. But the
fake policy fixture didn't override the default policy_dirs config,
that leads to fake policy fixture will load real policy config from
"/etc/nova/policy.d" and unittest will failed.

This patch override default policy_dirs value to empty list.

Change-Id: I7d8958dc2f0bb927b98b2bb86c99e855db6c5e2e
Closes-Bug: #1435327

Steve - could you comment on the type of notification that may be best for this (see commit message TO DO)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-03-12 16:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7725, 'date': '2015-03-12 18:46:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I don't think this can work because not all processes will get the notification (even on the same node). In a normal configuration this is where you would SIGHUP :-(  Is there any chance that we could have the manager check every X minutes if the data is updated and the driver needs to be reconstructed? Or just have the driver constructed every time?"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-03-12 20:59:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@David,

We would need to also tell keystone to tear down it's connections. If someone is using the LDAP connection pool for example, those connections wouldn't know that the new data was there, and we'd be back to the same place of standing up/tearing down the connections for *every* request.

I think we need something that is going to address this via an IPC-like construct or at least in a caching way that can manage the update in a sane manner/consistent manner."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2015-03-20 10:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-20 12:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

(1 comment)

Does it already tear down the old connections when it updates/deletes the current configuration?'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2015-03-20 15:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Gabriel, so when you update the config it doesn't tear down any connections - it just updated the domino config table with the new config. If we do nothing else, then you would have to re-start the keystone server in order for this configs to be active (just like we have to do today with the file-based configuration scheme). So the goal of this patch is to try and avoid that...in a way that is guaranteed to get all keystone processes (there are often multiple running for performance reasons)."}, {'account_id': 10917, 'date': '2015-03-20 19:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've got what the patch is meant to do. I like the way you've chosen to update the configuration of the domain.

I only asked as a reminder of what Morgan Fainberg mentioned in his previous comment. I don't know how it would behave regarding the connections the way the patch is now, and I don't know how it should behave."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2015-03-21 11:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Gabriel,

So fair question.  This patch now takes the caching approach - i.e. we don't try and notify all the various processes/threads....we just let them discover the new config as the cache times-out. The only remaining question I have (as per the commit comment) is whether re-loading the ldap driver object in one thread, while a potential another thread is in that very driver, will cause problems. I'm kind of thinking it should be OK, since although in thread A we delete the driver object (and create a new one), Python won't actually throw the old one away yet since it is being referenced in thread B. Once thread B finishes that command, when it picks up the next command, and goes to find the driver, it will get the new one."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-03-21 18:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

Until FFE is granted.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-03-24 19:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

[{'created': '2015-03-11 08:53:12.000000000', 'message': 'Reload drivers when their domain config is updated

When a domain config is modifed, in order for those configs
to actual be live, we need to re-initialise the backend
identity driver for the respective domain.

To Do:

Need to confirm whether this will operate correctly across the
multiple threads and process environments that keystone might
be running. E.g. do we have to make the notification public so
that all keystone processes will update their internal driver
structures.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext

become visible to any keystone process.

commit_message:
Reload drivers when their domain config is updated

When a domain config is modifed, in order for those configs
to actually be live, we need to re-initialise the backend
identity driver for the respective domain.

This patch uses cache timeouts to ensure that new config options
become visible to all keystone processes/threads.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext
Change-Id: I1a802dde53f25f945eadd235574e9c342a770443

commit_message:
Provide Identity version for negative tests

This patch fixes broken DSVM gate after a change in tempest
cred_provider.

Change-Id: I9a33f981d693ca482fed19e6d38a3439376c0e35
Related-Bug: #1436288

commit_message:
Add whole disk image support for iscsi_ilo using agent ramdisk

This commit adds support for whole disk images to be
used with iscsi_ilo when using agent ramdisk.

Closes-Bug: 1434452
Change-Id: I62d2650c2f3a117dc68dd96aefecc8c2364b3add

commit_message:
Fix PciDeviceDBApiTestCase with referential constraint checking

PciDeviceDBApiTestCase relies on being able to create database rows
without referential constraint checking, which is the default on
sqlite but not other backends. This change adds the required compute
node row when creating pci device rows.

Change-Id: I5c31f75d612946237a939acd86c143d895580fda

commit_message:
Fix stack-update for OS::Nova::Server resource

This fixes stack-update for `OS::Nova::Server` resource, when
network name rather than network id is used.

Change-Id: I484f7f8890485eca42eaa31e034f6d19b369c72a
Closes-Bug: #1439071

commit_message:
remove usage of policy.d which isn't cached

This is a partial revert of Id8e1e84cd3717dfd0a3b3f80acec50f96c205251

The policy.d infrastructure was not previously tested anywhere real,
and turns out that it completely invalidates the caching of policy
files. Using policy.d means that nova-api makes > 33k reparses of the
policy files during a gate run.

There is no straight forward fix at this point in the cycle given
various library freezes in oslo. Instead we should revert using the
policy.d directory and merge those rules back into the policy.json
file.

Change-Id: I588c46819728e839f9e6c03ac3d673646d76b7ff
Closes-Bug: #1438861

commit_message:
Add missed links in DataProcessing API docs

Links for following types of API calls are missed:
 * image registry
 * plugins
 * jobs
 * jobs exec
 * job types

We should take this links back.

commit_message:
Fix KeyError for euca-describe-images

EC2 describe images crashes on volume backed instance snapshot which has
several volumes.

merged from Ibe278688b118db01c9c3ae1763954adf19c7ee0d
related bug #1370265

Change-Id: I538bc2cf1a2093bc8055350d01ce406505776db5

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-27 23:47:37.000000000', 'message': 'Process batched messages in Python API correctly

Python API now has a reference issue that only logs the last
of a batch of incoming messages, as many times as there are
messages in the batch.

Change-Id: I50daf0b2281ff49e03c58e7c91a998d403ea2f7c
Closes-Bug: 1414852
'}]
commit_message:
Process batched messages in Python API correctly

Python API now has a reference issue that only logs the last
of a batch of incoming messages, as many times as there are
messages in the batch.

Change-Id: I50daf0b2281ff49e03c58e7c91a998d403ea2f7c
Closes-Bug: 1414852

[{'created': '2015-04-01 23:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 issues and add apache header to subunit2html

This commit fixes pep8 issues that were added when subunit2html was
copied into the repo. As part of this the subunit2html was missing a
license header for the additions made to it on top of the original
HTMLTestRunner script it was based on. The addition of the copyright
header mirrors project-config change:
I6fc16d316012fd3e1c196f74df25d725a310f6dc

Change-Id: Ieb42d5baddb3e1446fcd50197136f605324323aa
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 issues and add apache header to subunit2html

This commit fixes pep8 issues that were added when subunit2html was
copied into the repo. As part of this the subunit2html was missing a
license header for the additions made to it on top of the original
HTMLTestRunner script it was based on. The addition of the copyright
header mirrors project-config change:
I6fc16d316012fd3e1c196f74df25d725a310f6dc

Change-Id: Ieb42d5baddb3e1446fcd50197136f605324323aa

Add information about Clusters api

Adding wadl and json sample files for Clusters of Data Processing
project.

commit_message:
Update docs and security-docs teams

For docs:
Add openstackdocstheme as new repository, remove recently removed folks
from core-team list. Fix typos in Summer's and Shilla's login.
Add three new core members.

For security-docs:
Add Nathaniel Dillon (sicarie)

Change-Id: I90609adbb32cf1e6a86e0ea83483ef6f9b464466

commit_message:
Add GERRIT_KEY and GERRIT_SERVER options in scripts

This allows the user to specify the private key to use to connect
to the gerrit server, and to specify which gerrit server to use.

Change-Id: I391e9a81350dfc8820d181392574b2cd8f2c3f6a

Add the possibility to choose a gerrit server in this script, to
be consistent with the other command-line utilities.

Change-Id: I342fa0f68242316e7ef7bb5959118fdd32d10b9e
'}, {'created': '2015-04-02 13:41:09.000000000', 'message': 'Document installation from repository

The reviewstats library cannot be installed from PyPI as it is, as
a tag is needed, or at least a package download URL must be

commit_message:
Document installation from repository

The reviewstats library cannot be installed from PyPI as it is, as
a tag is needed, or at least a package download URL must be
specified. A user can still install the library and the utilities
by cloning the repo and running the setup script, and therefore
this process is documented rather than the erroneous pip command.

Change-Id: I342fa0f68242316e7ef7bb5959118fdd32d10b9e

commit_message:
Json exporters for stats added

For system tests purposes http handlers for fetching stats
added into analytics.
Implemented OSWLs exporters:
- /api/v1/json/oswls/<master_node_uid>,
- /api/v1/json/oswls/<master_node_uid>/<resource_type>
Implemented installation info exporter:
- /api/v1/json/installation_info/<master_node_uid>

Change-Id: I4b049bb8b955ca98dab18ddcd9f96f9965bb9902
Closes-Bug: #1438228

Previously 'tox -epep8' just says run 'tox -v -euuidgen' but without
manually removing the duplicate uuid it fails to fix things and says run
'tox -v -euuidgen' again.

Change-Id: I1948c2d038d89af8dcfe69d01dcc49d024ae3210
"}, {'created': '2015-03-27 17:16:00.000000000', 'message': "Clarify how to resolve a uuid collision

Previously 'tox -epep8' just says run 'tox -v -euuidgen' but without

Change-Id: I1948c2d038d89af8dcfe69d01dcc49d024ae3210
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify how to resolve a uuid collision

Previously 'tox -epep8' just says run 'tox -v -euuidgen' but without
manually removing the duplicate uuid it fails to fix things and says run
'tox -v -euuidgen' again.

Change-Id: I1948c2d038d89af8dcfe69d01dcc49d024ae3210

commit_message:
Simplify `wait_for` calls

Rely on the the `check_for_*` functions and remove redundant
`fail_unless_*` calls.

Also change `wait_for` to exit when it is missing a required argument.

Change-Id: I90c4545691d53185556e2838303ac3df0afaf9fa

subject: Replace SQL code for ORM analog in DB migration scripts
messages:
[{'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-30 16:05:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-30 16:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-30 16:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

TODO: update other SQL occurrences.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-30 16:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-30 16:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:13:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks to me like this is more lines of code and more complexity, to achieve exactly the same end result.

Did the original migration fail on Postgres? Is there a use case that the new code handles better than the old code?

I can understand that in some cases where non-standard SQL is used, this approach may be better, but I can't see how it's better for really simple tables copies."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-manila-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-pep8/71716a6/ : SUCCESS in 3m 28s

- gate-manila-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-python27/0265c68/ : SUCCESS in 3m 33s
- gate-manila-tox-genconfig http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-tox-genconfig/2144cf1/ : SUCCESS in 3m 00s
- gate-manila-pylint http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-pylint/4af0952/ : SUCCESS in 3m 58s (non-voting)
- gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron/bfbb16f/ : SUCCESS in 46m 48s
- gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multibackend http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multibackend/0901387/ : SUCCESS in 49m 32s
- gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-no-share-servers http://logs.openstack.org/83/168983/2/check/gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-no-share-servers/e475d06/ : SUCCESS in 41m 35s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-30 21:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ben,

Here is "why":

1) No mixing of different approaches. Usage of only one - ORM abstraction (supports 7 dialects [1]). It should have been so from the beginning.

2) Real need is in upcoming changes for other two migrations with agggregations.

P.S. I assume existing one can be minimized. And I can not agreee it is more complex.

Original migrations are running now only in unit tests where is no data.

So, migrations are not used competely to check whether it fails with some other DB backend or not.

[1] http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/dialects/'}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2015-03-31 01:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Even if the job only tests postgresql with an empty database, that still proved that installs on postgresql are possible, which is better than what we what we used to have.

Testing upgrades/downgrades with a database full of records is also something we need to do, and that applies to MySQL in addition to Postgresql. I think there is a project called "grenade" that does something like that.

As for this change, I look forward to seeing the rest of the upgrade steps'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-31 09:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-31 09:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-31 10:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Replace SQL code for ORM analog in DB migration scripts

Replace explicit usage of SQL code with appropriate analog of ORM.
It allows to keep abstraction between DB and python clear without
potential incompatibilities due to differencies in SQL dialects.

Change-Id: Ied97264cafcec0bcebd4c3ddc7b29185825c56a6
Closes-Bug: #1437278

commit_message:
convert CMD output to array before comparing

Some times patchcords was added bebore bond interface. In thos case full-text search may give
wrong positive answer. (substring 'bond0' found inside 'br-bond0').

Change-Id: Ie54d94ce83906a972b422c5a5bb048d61f26db7f
Closes-bug: #1375347
(cherry picked from commit 6716a3ece8fb9cba2874039189a325a41c6086b2)

commit_message:
Migrate API calls to task management

Now that we have a task management framework, make sure all of the API
calls we make go through it. The net effect on people not taking
advantage of the feature should be zero, but should allow for porting of
nodepool to shade.

Change-Id: I0f2cf912f45e76c9f5194e3b8813278b883b4adc

subject: Keep history of updated resource attributes
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 13:44:01.000000000', 'message': "Keep history of updated resource attributes

This change keeps history of updated resource attributes
by creating a new row in resource_history tables each times the
resource table is updated.

Each resource extention table also gain a '<resource_name>_history' to
track their history too.

Change-Id: I0960bf155654444b044b1b11aa49d252d5f212c5
"}]
commit_message:
Keep history of updated resource attributes

This change keeps history of updated resource attributes
by creating a new row in resource_history tables each times the
resource table is updated.

Each resource extention table also gain a '<resource_name>_history' to
track their history too.

Change-Id: I0960bf155654444b044b1b11aa49d252d5f212c5

subject: ClippyJS: Make help more awesome.
messages:
[{'account_id': 8512, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

FFE?'}, {'account_id': 8674, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:48:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't see clippy appear in Horizon.
The menu accordion is broken.
Users can't log out because the dropdown for loging out doesn't work.
When launching an instance, we get a non-modal form view.

Apart from these issues, this patch is a great idea, I'm impatient to seeing a new patch-set solving the above issues :-)"}, {'account_id': 8876, 'date': '2015-04-01 15:25:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Noooo the revenge of Office's paperclip!

Haha April fools' day :D"}, {'account_id': 12699, 'date': '2015-04-01 15:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 14:22:17.000000000', 'message': 'ClippyJS: Make help more awesome.

In this age of virtual assistants (e.g., Siri, Cortana) Horizon
should have one that people recognize to help them. This
introduces Clippy to Horizon to be used as a virtual assistant
and helper. This is the foundation which can be built upon.
For more information see https://www.smore.com/clippy-js

Change-Id: I63e56e50f1362e59324be7c9bd7f9fd2d925e523
'}]
commit_message:
ClippyJS: Make help more awesome.

In this age of virtual assistants (e.g., Siri, Cortana) Horizon
should have one that people recognize to help them. This
introduces Clippy to Horizon to be used as a virtual assistant
and helper. This is the foundation which can be built upon.
For more information see https://www.smore.com/clippy-js

Change-Id: I63e56e50f1362e59324be7c9bd7f9fd2d925e523

commit_message:
Backport for testing of cluster stats structure

Checking that all required cluster attributes and relationships
exported into installation info structure implemented.
Checking that all required cluster attribures exported into
installation info structure implemented.
Transformantion function added to attributes white list.
Named tuple used for white lists.

Change-Id: I766d586f84abfb9213b0d8dc5698715c99650184
Closes-Bug: #1438576

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 21:42:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix the event type for trusts

The event type that is defined by default is incorrect, it's missing
an asterisk, that will pick up the 'create' and 'delete' keywords.

Change-Id: I93175f7beaca3b7961d0431fd8c6ba819b3f164b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the event type for trusts

The event type that is defined by default is incorrect, it's missing
an asterisk, that will pick up the 'create' and 'delete' keywords.

Change-Id: I93175f7beaca3b7961d0431fd8c6ba819b3f164b

The service in generic_service should require the related package
by title and not by name.

Change-Id: If4aacb10800b274810845b5656c3c6e0be1fd255

commit_message:
Fix package dependency to be on title instead of name

The service in generic_service should require the related package
by title and not by name.

Change-Id: If4aacb10800b274810845b5656c3c6e0be1fd255

[{'created': '2015-03-29 04:06:13.000000000', 'message': 'Use libreswan on fedora

Without this patch, Fedora systems will always try to install openswan
instead of libreswan. This is a problem on Fedora 20 and 21 which do
not have openswan available. Fedora 19 has both packages available, so
this patch changes the params.pp to install libreswan if the
operatingsystem fact is Fedora.

Change-Id: I6043dbda057ad254bd706b2d8c4d0b2ce0ffef5e
'}]
commit_message:
Use libreswan on fedora

Without this patch, Fedora systems will always try to install openswan
instead of libreswan. This is a problem on Fedora 20 and 21 which do
not have openswan available. Fedora 19 has both packages available, so
this patch changes the params.pp to install libreswan if the
operatingsystem fact is Fedora.

Change-Id: I6043dbda057ad254bd706b2d8c4d0b2ce0ffef5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 10:15:33.000000000', 'message': "spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the rspec-puppet
release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax order to be prepared
for rspec 3.x move.

In details:
* Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
* Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x)
* Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
* Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
  puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ice356e35a65204a62e47f49dd4f5816208a6dace
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the rspec-puppet
release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax order to be prepared
for rspec 3.x move.

In details:
* Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
* Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x)
* Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
* Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
  puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ice356e35a65204a62e47f49dd4f5816208a6dace
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create swift container if it does not exist

In the glance v2 image upload workflow, the user is not doing things
with swift containers, swift containers are being created by shade. This
means that it's shade's responsibility to ensure that the container
exists before it attempts to upload something to it.

Change-Id: I34cfc2821819aec105947dbe70a578307e583d77

commit_message:
Add puppet-lint-param-docs plugins to puppet-lint

- This puppet-lint plugin checks if all parameters are documented
- Fix all the undocumented parameters.

Change-Id: I2f24ebc7c1493572f0e638da3b7a9dc73784a8aa

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

- This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
  puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some just
  catch common errors.

Change-Id: I4f96d4dc285bd6aa0ae5e4294ccd730cc4ee5c45
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add experimental configurable delay for scheduler

This patch add new config option for changing timeout beetween executing
tasks in scheduler.

Change-Id: Ibb06371c2aae3883c4dc7457b15a54cd6278a044

commit_message:
Report status of boot loader installation to Ironic

This commit changes the 80-deploy-ironic script of
deploy-ironic element to report back the status of
boot loader install (when boot_option == "local")
using a newly introduced vendorpassthru.

Closes-Bug: 1422723
Change-Id: I9c1d8643be7cb9e273d65ddd791715a5c271fd93

[{'created': '2015-03-29 04:59:35.000000000', 'message': "Add task management framework

Some shade clients, like nodepool, have a need to manage threads that
are doing API tasks and to manage rate limiting. That's not really a
thing that's appropriate for shade to know about, but because shade does
want to know the business logic, we need to provide a mechanism for
people to do that.

TaskManager is essentially nodepool.TaskManager except with
threading features removed and reworked to do instantaneous blocking
execution, since that's the behavior that most users will expect.

A patch will follow to move API calls to be manged by Tasks and the
shade.TaskManager. Once those are there, then nodepool can pass in its
TaskManager and the API operations in shade will naturally be managed by
the rate-limited operations in nodepool.

Change-Id: I60d25271de4009ee3f7f7684c72299fbd5d0f54f

commit_message:
Add task management framework

Some shade clients, like nodepool, have a need to manage threads that
are doing API tasks and to manage rate limiting. That's not really a
thing that's appropriate for shade to know about, but because shade does
want to know the business logic, we need to provide a mechanism for
people to do that.

TaskManager is essentially nodepool.TaskManager except with
threading features removed and reworked to do instantaneous blocking
execution, since that's the behavior that most users will expect.

A patch will follow to move API calls to be manged by Tasks and the
shade.TaskManager. Once those are there, then nodepool can pass in its
TaskManager and the API operations in shade will naturally be managed by
the rate-limited operations in nodepool.

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@openstack.org>
Change-Id: I60d25271de4009ee3f7f7684c72299fbd5d0f54f

commit_message:
Namespace caching per cloud

In places where we have multiple clouds, such as nodepool, if we want
to use shared or persistent caching, we need to include cloud name in
the cache so that we don't try to return rackspace flavors to hp clouds.

Change-Id: I65a7b1bf6818f6b40b42bd2fa4b560f127c5589b

- gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-no-share-servers http://logs.openstack.org/28/162628/5/check/gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-neutron-no-share-servers/33c4f61/ : FAILURE in 38m 53s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 8851, 'date': '2015-03-11 08:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Mark,

First of all, existing code is Neutron specific and verification for Neutron usage in cloud should be added.

Second, creation of router is useful only for generic driver, and, moreover, onely for one of two possible configurations of it (this one is just default). So, in case of all other drivers and other generic driver configurations you do redundant operations.

Third, you do not use share network from "share manager instance". In that case you won't need to bother yourself with share-network deletion at all. Hence, you won't need to bother yourself with network resources creation.

Forth, code is specific for one of two possible driver modes - when share servers are handled.

Fifth, scenario tests should have its own test run, separately from API tests.

Sixth, all new Neutron subnets are created with same IP range. So, if we use more than one subnet with same IP range we get "duplication error" using NetApp driver, for example. It means, only one net/subnet should be used for all share servers creation within Tempest.

So, in conclusion, here is a lot of work to do, for the moment.'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2015-03-11 13:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2015-03-12 12:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2015-03-12 12:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2015-03-12 12:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2015-03-12 12:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-12 13:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add initial scenario test for Manila

Adapt manager and add first initial test for Manila. A ping check will
be performed to check the connectivity from the VM to the share
server/service. The test can be triggered using the experimental test
job introduced by [1].

Open todo's that can be addressed later:
 - Support of flat network
 - More flexible configuration options

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164102/

Change-Id: Ie72e877a88c337866e9cb591f8099218d84ee5dd
Partially-implements: blueprint scenario-tests

commit_message:
Allow for passing cache class in as a parameter

It's possible you'd want to set the cache class either as a programmatic
parameter to the constructor, or in the clouds.yaml config file.
Facilitate both.

Depends-On: I6c9eab71a88a534de7e52ad2a564450c44aacc1d
Change-Id: I9575eae869881bf6784d2d867f2f571ddbab7769

commit_message:
SSP Disk Driver: connect_disk

Implement connect_disk in the SSP disk driver.  This creates a VSCSI
mapping to the LPAR's LU on each VIOS which is both a) on this host, and
b) a member of the Cluster.

Change-Id: Ie1cc4cf38c05cca596a9c65feaf05970e20dd8ee

commit_message:
Move orphaned api test - deux

According to changes [1,2], API tests' new home is under neutron/tests/api.
Change 92d2054f8a slipped through the cracks. It seems also that wrong
imports lead to tests silently dropped (i.e. not executed). This patch
rectifies the issue.

 [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169850/
 [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167320/

Change-Id: I64be376d7cff9512bd027720116dc039831e7955

commit_message:
Don't add exception instance in LOG.exception

LOG.exception will print out the full stacktrace, that's enough.
We should only record meaningful message.

merged from I8b5c581717e6b78c11c46e226463927450c9f287

Change-Id: I49865d558ff5feda2d6a803741fbee18064b2aec

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 09:55:03.000000000', 'message': "Use versioncmp for '::operatingsystemmajrelease' comparison

Use the builtin versioncmp() function for comparisons of the
'::operatingsystemmajrelease' fact. If that fact evaluates to a string,
regular arithmetric comparisons will fail under the Puppet 4.x
language.

Change-Id: Ic66516a5548be0fe6f6fb818d04086cf234f2fc1
Closes-bug: 1425300
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use versioncmp for '::operatingsystemmajrelease' comparison

Use the builtin versioncmp() function for comparisons of the
'::operatingsystemmajrelease' fact. If that fact evaluates to a string,
regular arithmetric comparisons will fail under the Puppet 4.x
language.

Change-Id: Ic66516a5548be0fe6f6fb818d04086cf234f2fc1
Closes-bug: 1425300
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tag all Ceilometer packages

Some users wish to override the default package provider by their own.

Tag all packages with the 'openstack' to allow mass resource attributes
override using resource collectors.

Closes-bug: #1391209

Change-Id: If43101b9974d26c88f8612da64c5356a644f892e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 04:02:16.000000000', 'message': "Install packaged pyOpenSSL

pyOpenSSL has done a rewrite of itself in Python.  This may be good
for many reasons, but memory usage is not one of them.  It just about
doubles the size of at least swift, which usually consumes about 6% of
a CI testing vm's 8gb RAM.  This is enough to push centos hosts into
OOM conditions and then everything falls apart.

The distro packages of pyOpenSSL are the older C-based versions, which
doesn't bring in the kitchen sink of cffi & pycparser.

Change-Id: Icd4100da1d5cbdb82017da046b00b9397813c2f2
"}]
commit_message:
Install packaged pyOpenSSL

pyOpenSSL has done a rewrite of itself in Python.  This may be good
for many reasons, but memory usage is not one of them.  It just about
doubles the size of at least swift, which usually consumes about 6% of
a CI testing vm's 8gb RAM.  This is enough to push centos hosts into
OOM conditions and then everything falls apart.

The distro packages of pyOpenSSL are the older C-based versions, which
doesn't bring in the kitchen sink of cffi & pycparser.

Change-Id: Icd4100da1d5cbdb82017da046b00b9397813c2f2

(1 comment)

FileHandler is not able to detect file rotation done by logrotate ... and continues to log on the same inode after file rotation (sick)!

A workaround is to use logrotate 'copytruncate': in such case logrotate copies and truncates the log file into of moving it ... it implies some logs can be lost betweeen copy and truncate. And it's backward incompatible which seems not acceptable according to kilo schedule."}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2015-04-01 20:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 14323, 'date': '2015-04-01 20:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-05 00:18:09.000000000', 'message': 'Allow metadata proxy to log with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot be runned with nobody user/group as
metadata proxy (as others services) uses WatchedFileHandler handler to
log to file which does not support permissions drop (the process must
able to r/w after permissions drop to "watch" the file).

This change allows to choose between 3 logging modes for metadata proxy
(using metadata_proxy_log_mode option):
* legacy: as currently inherits logging config from agent one (default),
* unwatch: similar to legacy except that WatchedFileHandlerhandlers are
  replaced by FileHandler which implies to use copytruncate option in
  logrotate if logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy logging files,
* syslog: metadata proxy uses only syslog (even the agent logs to a
  file).

It allows to change how metadata proxy logs without changing how the
agent logs. Unwatched and syslog modes support permissions drop as r/w
permissions are required to open the file/socket only during startup.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I40a7bd82a2c60d9198312fdb52e3010c60db3511
Partial-Bug: #1427228

'}, {'created': '2015-03-20 19:39:12.000000000', 'message': 'Allow metadata proxy to log with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as
metadata proxy (as others services) uses WatchedFileHandler handler to
log to file which does not support permissions drop (the process must
able to r/w after permissions drop to "watch" the file).

This change allows to enable/disable log watch in metadata proxies with
the new option metadata_proxy_log_watch (default=True). It should be
disabled when metadata_proxy_user/group is not allowed to read/write
metadata proxy log files.

When log watch is disabled and logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy
logging files, 'copytruncate' logrotate option must be used otherwise
metadata proxy logs will be lost after the first log rotation.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I40a7bd82a2c60d9198312fdb52e3010c60db3511
Partial-Bug: #1427228

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as
metadata proxy (as others services) uses WatchedFileHandler handler to
log to file which does not support permissions drop (the process must
able to r/w after permissions drop to "watch" the file).

This change allows to enable/disable log watch in metadata proxies with
the new option metadata_proxy_log_watch. It should be disabled when
metadata_proxy_user/group is not allowed to read/write metadata proxy
log files. Option default value is deduced from metadata_proxy_user:

* True if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user id/name,
* False otherwise.

When log watch is disabled and logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy
logging files, 'copytruncate' logrotate option must be used otherwise
metadata proxy logs will be lost after the first log rotation.

commit_message:
Allow metadata proxy to log with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as
metadata proxy (as other services) uses WatchedFileHandler handler to
log to file which does not support permissions drop (the process must
be able to r/w after permissions drop to "watch" the file).

This change allows to enable/disable log watch in metadata proxies with
the new option metadata_proxy_log_watch. It should be disabled when
metadata_proxy_user/group is not allowed to read/write metadata proxy
log files. Option default value is deduced from metadata_proxy_user:

* True if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user id/name,
* False otherwise.

When log watch is disabled and logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy
logging files, 'copytruncate' logrotate option must be used otherwise
metadata proxy logs will be lost after the first log rotation.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I40a7bd82a2c60d9198312fdb52e3010c60db3511
Partial-Bug: #1427228

that occured during the run of Rally and store them to

commit_message:
Script that profiles imports

If you run Rally with this code it will profile all imports
that occured during the run of Rally and store them to

imports_full_info.json and as well store 100 longest in file
imports_100_longest.txt

Change-Id: I3e4eff1b7895f28fc9495ff11dcb7dc343380407

commit_message:
User Guides: Fix :option: warnings

Fix warnings about wrong usage of :option: that more recent Sphinx
versions emit:

WARNING: Malformed :option: u'quota_items', does not contain option
marker - or -- or / or +

Change-Id: Ib463a08353e99be82285c944545d4aca6637a5bd

commit_message:
Sort the panel's variable in the dashboards.py

In the dashboards.py some PanelGroup's variable
use(slug,name.panels), and some use(name, slug, panels),
we can unit it, used as(slug,name.panels).

Change-Id: If508fcb59c372c581938152db8bceb4ed849c256
Closes-bug:#1438984

commit_message:
Fix problem with deploy cinder-vmware role

The role cinder is "upstream" for the role cinder-vmware
which depend on it. Cinder was changed and cinder-vmware
should be changed after that.

Change-Id: I97c9d32d93fc3bb47a655be5a1cec69216b55f8f
Closes-bug: 1433201

[{'account_id': 7219, 'date': '2015-01-27 16:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2015-01-27 17:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm not convinced this really works.  Forcing "if mystr" instead of "if len(mystr) ..." changes behavior, because using len implicitly asserts that the variable is a string.

Since this change discourages some ability to express "if string has len > 1" vs "if the string is an empty string" vs "if the string is None", I feel like this may lead to more errors than if we didn't enforce this as a rule.

Generally, it looks like this check is too broad to account for cases where it is sensible to use this form.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-01-27 18:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

(2 comments)

@Eric Harney - as I said in the comments len isn't really implicitly saying that a variable is a string, many types have a __len__ method such as list, dict, set etc. If something should be a string there should be a specific check or conversion made when the function gets the var.

If the test is "if string has len > 1" that would suggest that the test cares about the magnitude of the length as opposed to whether or not it has length. This change is for the common case when the condition is whether or not a thing is empty and not its size.

If the code needs to distinguish between when a string is None and when a string is empty that isn't made more difficult by this patch, e.g.:

if var is None:
    pass
elif not var:
    pass

The check allows for the test to be skipped on a line if noqa is there but I couldn't find a case in the code where it was necessary. If you could give me any more examples as to where you think this is an issue it might help me to understand your objections better but as it is I don't feel your concerns are justified with what is something I would regard as idiomatic python.'}, {'account_id': 10628, 'date': '2015-01-28 02:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck emc-vnx'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-01-28 03:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1
