commit_message:
Add support for policy types, 'erasure_coding' policy

This patch extends the StoragePolicy class for non-replication storage
policies, the first one being "erasure coding".

Changes:

 - Add 'policy_type' support to BaseStoragePolicy class
 - Disallow direct instatiation of BaseStoragePolicy class

 - Subclass BaseStoragePolicy

   - "StoragePolicy":
     . Replication policy, default
     . policy_type = 'replication'

   - "ECStoragePolicy":
     . Erasure Coding policy
     . policy_type = 'erasure_coding'
     . Private member variables
       ec_type (EC backend),
       ec_num_data_fragments (number of fragments original
         data split into after erasure coding operation),
       ec_num_parity_fragments (number of parity fragments
       generated during erasure coding)
     . Private methods
       EC specific metadata and ring validator methods.

 - Swift will use PyECLib, a Python Erasure Coding library,
   for erasure coding operations. This patch adds PyECLib to
   Swift requirements.txt. PyECLib is already an approved
   OpenStack core requirement.
   (https://bitbucket.org/kmgreen2/pyeclib/)

 - Add test cases for
   - 'policy_type' StoragePolicy member
   - policy_type == 'erasure_coding'

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie0e09796e3ec45d3e656fb7540d0e5a5709b8386
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work

commit_message:
Add scripts for logstash, elasticsearch, kibana

This set of scripts sets up the infrastructure for managing the
monitoring data.  Logstash receives performance metric from collectd
via the udp protocol and logs from rsyslog via the RELP protocol.
They should be coming from the nodejs and mongodb servers.
Logstash then forwards the data stream to elasticsearch for storage and
indexing.  The script for logstash configuration expects the IP address
for the elasticsearch server as the environment elasticsearch_ip.
The scripts are designed to install these as services on separate
servers.

Kibana is the web app to display the monitoring data.
It should be accessible at:
http://<kibana_ip>:5601

Implements: blueprint translate-tosca-monitoring-usecase
Change-Id: I117a26a435bd81f496b1fa58c667316d9cc7ffe5

commit_message:
Add scripts to set up monitoring

This set of scripts installs and configures collectd and rsyslog on a server.
They are set up as service to send monitoring data (collectd) and system logs
(rsyslog) to a logstash server, so the config scripts expects the IP for
logstash in the environment variable logstash_ip.
Collectd uses the udp protocol and rsyslog uses the RELP protocol.

Implements: blueprint translate-tosca-monitoring-usecase
Change-Id: Id594111df2af4e63027312229eb60ac167ed57df

reference to original api doc page. Orders and
consumers have not been verified and therefore
have not been ported over.

took me a few cycles to realise that RedHat.yaml is consumed by virtue of %{osfamily} ("yes, but where is it being consumed?!?!"). I am guessing that if the file isn't available (you don't specify the override file at all) puppet doesn't throw a fit'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2015-03-19 12:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

marios: exactly. osfamily is what actually wires in the RedHat.yaml file so that it is used. You can see some documentation about it online here:  https://docs.puppetlabs.com/hiera/1/puppet.html.

If there is no yaml file present for a specific osfamily it would silently fail and work fine too. That is assuming there were no customizations needed for that distribution.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2015-03-19 12:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-19 12:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
puppet: wire in osfamily hieradata support

This updates all of the puppet roles to use an optional
osfamily hieradata file which can be used to provide
distro specific settings.

Also, updates the controller role to make use of this
new file for setting the rabbitmq package_provider
parameter.

Change-Id: I46417db51b87b82bf276dfcef5647a90c37fb07d

commit_message:
Add requirement for python-memcached

openstack/common/memorycache.py does an "import memcache" but the
dependent library is not listed in the requirements.

Change-Id: I14971ecbeb45943d53c524aef52141f235b91060

This set of scripts is used in the first 2 nodes for the monitoring
use case.  They install mongodb and nodejs, configure and start them.
The config script for nodejs is designed for the paypal nodejs app:
https://github.com/paypal/rest-api-sample-app-nodejs.git

commit_message:
Update set of scripts for mongodb and nodejs

This set of scripts is used in the first 2 nodes for the monitoring
use case.  They install mongodb and nodejs, configure and start them.
The config script for nodejs is designed for the paypal nodejs app:
https://github.com/paypal/rest-api-sample-app-nodejs.git
It configures the link to the mongodb database for the app.
The scripts have been validated by deploying to 2 VM's using Heat
templates.

Implements: blueprint translate-tosca-monitoring-usecase
Change-Id: I08d20ed40bbe23a2193ba1892d6d23b4bd7804f6

commit_message:
Add python-guestfs package for Nova Kilo

In the current dev releases of Nova's Kilo packages, python-guestfs is
needed, since the fallback methods are not supported.

Change-Id: Ib6cbef2440207c49e8a7c5ee792c6eaa0b522cbe
Closes-Bug: #1428639

commit_message:
Tag all neutron packages

Some users wish to override the default package provider by their own.

Tag all packages with the 'openstack' to allow mass resource attributes
override using resource collectors.

Change-Id: I7ea5ae48f1bd2ab218b44cb68b20787b5d16e58d
Related-bug: #1391209

commit_message:
Add authentication using openID and SAML

To enable websso, make sure you have your environment configured.
Then add following to Horizon settings:
WEBSSO_ENABLED=True

Also make sure your KEYSTONE is version 3+

Depends on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136177/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151842/

Co-Authored-By: Thai Tran <tqtran@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jose Castro Leon <jose.castro.leon@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>

implements bp federated-identity
Change-Id: Ief74bece750ffe633d4323238cad89bad61496ed

commit_message:
puppet: add debug mode for OpenStack services

Propagate the top-level Debug parameter wherever it makes sense.

Swift doesn't have this kind of debug setting, it only allows to
configure log levels, so we'll need a different approach there.

Change-Id: I15332315a2fbaeaf924cde4e748fb0e064a778b7

commit_message:
Add instructions for configuring LBaaS V2 with ODL

This has been tested to come up, so add instructions on how to try
it out for those wanting to try OpenDaylight with the Neutron
LBaaS V2 API.

Change-Id: I35b5f67fab4ebdbde926fd60e3b43dea0ed87858

commit_message:
Move specs that didn't land in Kilo to the backlog

We are well into FFE time, and some specs/bp are not approved to
land in Kilo, we should move them to the backlog so folks do not
assume they landed in Kilo.

Change-Id: I907488b627d4760a39d7c21f21b5ebeceaac79b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 13:18:26.000000000', 'message': 'Use WEBROOT setting for the 500 page home button

The home button on the 500 page currently links to "/" which is not
always the true app root, in settings we define a WEBROOT
variable so that we can inform the app of its actual location.

This patch uses that variable to set href location for the home link
on the 500 page, so it will be acurate for all cases.

To make this possible the load_conf template tag now returns conf
itself instead of conf.HORIZON_CONFIG giving the template access to
more of the settings including WEBROOT.

Change-Id: I9d42ac8eeb7f2bf558ba86440fd5ae85ef591568
Closes-Bug: 1427903
'}]
commit_message:
Use WEBROOT setting for the 500 page home button

The home button on the 500 page currently links to "/" which is not
always the true app root, in settings we define a WEBROOT
variable so that we can inform the app of its actual location.

This patch uses that variable to set href location for the home link
on the 500 page, so it will be acurate for all cases.

To make this possible the load_conf template tag now returns conf
itself instead of conf.HORIZON_CONFIG giving the template access to
more of the settings including WEBROOT.

Change-Id: I9d42ac8eeb7f2bf558ba86440fd5ae85ef591568
Closes-Bug: 1427903

commit_message:
Ensure LXC bridge exists, is up, and has rules

Additional check to ensure the lxc bridge interface exists added when
starting networks. Additional edge cases in the bridge being created
and the interface made usable are tested and resolved when they fail.

In addition dnsmasq is only kicked when the container network is
modified.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I7350626bd736f815bd2a9ed0d4949d42cd5db9af
Closes-Bug: 1438374

commit_message:
Refactor/remove obsolete page_header blocks

Most of the page_header blocks were removed by previous patches, but
then brought back by regressions in Volumes and Data Processing. This
patch removes those leftover page_header blocks, and removes a few
templates that are not used in Horizon that were found during the
process.

Change-Id: Icbd03f0809a5c664b9b83f06bc398139c3de1184
Closes-Bug: 1436311

commit_message:
Allow node interfaces update if it's in 'discover' or 'error' state

Node inferfaces update is allowed when node is in one of the following states:
'discover', 'error'. It's locked for other node states.
It's not locked on node creation, i.e. when node.nic_interfaces is empty yet.

Partial-Bug: #1425901
Closes-Bug: #1428776

Change-Id: Icc60c432296c28e89d71b1fd0dd864870553a467

Virtualbox based VM that runs Swift storage node. There are
two major run scripts. Rhe first one run-remote.sh will expect
successfully setup of the Swift VM. Then rsync freezer directory
to the VM and finally execute remotely via SSH run-local.py script
that will create LVM volume and mount it so the functional tests
could be facilitated.

backup tests are included in this commit as the most common usecase.

commit_message:
Functional tests and Vagrant environment

Proposed environment utilizes Vagrant that works with KVM or
Virtualbox based VM that runs Swift storage node. There are
two major run scripts. Rhe first one run-remote.sh will expect
successfully setup of the Swift VM. Then rsync freezer directory
to the VM and finally execute remotely via SSH run-local.py script
that will create LVM volume and mount it so the functional tests
could be facilitated.

Regular file system (non LVM) and LVM snapshot non incremental
backup tests are included in this commit as the most common usecase.

BLUEPRINT: functional-testing
Change-Id: Ia9c1e2e770ca413fe4a896dd0a55c4babf3df686

commit_message:
Fix for flatten data for CSV reports

In case of lists or tuples we are joining data into one string.
Joining of non-string types fixed.
Vmware attributes added to tests for installation structure
generation function.

Change-Id: I46b21ae33fd4b50f0d2c5722584248beee8c4f17
Closes-Bug: #1439235

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 21:29:08.000000000', 'message': "Set fixed_network_name in Tempest config

This previously defatuled to 'private' and aligned with devstack's
defaults but it has since been updated to 'None'.  This sets the config
value according to devstack's.

Change-Id: I3f480d5480521a93992bedfe602eb20a4999263d
Closes-bug: #1438415
(cherry picked from commit 84ee55b3ee3630945792fa849d793a6d71d2364d)
"}]
commit_message:
Set fixed_network_name in Tempest config

This previously defatuled to 'private' and aligned with devstack's
defaults but it has since been updated to 'None'.  This sets the config
value according to devstack's.

Change-Id: I3f480d5480521a93992bedfe602eb20a4999263d
Closes-bug: #1438415
(cherry picked from commit 84ee55b3ee3630945792fa849d793a6d71d2364d)

I really want to see this log go away. I think my uncertainty with this patch is that to_dict() is doing what it should: converting an object to a dictionary.  But because one (and I presume the only) consumer of that method needs something special, we're modifying it in a way to suit said object. And I'm not familiar enough with the bigger picture of this piece to say, "yes, that's fine."

I'd be a lot more comfortable if we had a factory to produce that context that called to_dict(), subtracted the fields that that library can't handle afterwards, and then instantiated that object (or even a to_contextbase_dict, which called to_dict and then subtracted those two fields separately.)

If that sounds crazy, I can dig deeper to understand. [{'created': '2014-11-16 14:36:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "Arguments dropped when creating context" logging

This log was previously reduced from warning to debug.
Cinder removed it entirely in:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1329156

Change-Id: Ifd51b62bae7b96de44f04836015d2ed939bcb650
Closes-Bug: #1255441
'}, {'created': '2014-11-16 15:52:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "Arguments dropped when creating context" logging

This log was previously reduced from warning to debug.
Cinder removed it entirely in:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1329156

The root cause is this:
Agent heartbeats use an admin context. The context is serialized
with its to_dict method, which exposes 'tenant' and 'project_name'
(These are properties of the class that are calculated from other
attributes). In the controller, this dict is used to initialize a
ContextBase, which does not accept tenant and project_name as arguments,
de facto sending those values as key word arguments.

We can either handle 'tenant' and 'project_name' specially, fix
it any other way, or drop the logging entirely. Is this logging
ever useful?

Change-Id: Ifd51b62bae7b96de44f04836015d2ed939bcb650
Closes-Bug: #1255441
'}, {'created': '2014-11-20 09:59:57.000000000', 'message': 'Mitigate "Arguments dropped when creating context" logging

This log was previously reduced from warning to debug.
Cinder removed it entirely in:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1329156

The root cause is this:
Agent heartbeats use an admin context. The context is serialized
with its to_dict method, which exposes 'tenant' and 'project_name'
(These are properties of the class that are calculated from other
attributes). In the controller, this dict is used to initialize a
ContextBase, which does not accept tenant and project_name as arguments,
de facto sending those values as key word arguments.

Remove 'tenant' and 'project_name' from ContextBase.to_dict
so that when a Context is serialized and reconstructed, the ContextBase
init function doesn't have to deal with them.

Change-Id: Ifd51b62bae7b96de44f04836015d2ed939bcb650
Closes-Bug: #1255441

commit_message:
Remove "Arguments dropped when creating context" logging

This log was previously reduced from warning to debug.
Cinder removed it entirely in:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1329156

The root cause is this:
Agent heartbeats use an admin context. The context is serialized
with its to_dict method, which exposes 'tenant' and 'project_name'
(These are properties of the class that are calculated from other
attributes). In the controller, this dict is used to initialize a
ContextBase, which does not accept tenant and project_name as arguments,
de facto sending those values as key word arguments.

We can either handle 'tenant' and 'project_name' specially, fix
it any other way, or drop the logging entirely. Is this logging
ever useful?

Change-Id: Ifd51b62bae7b96de44f04836015d2ed939bcb650
Closes-Bug: #1255441

The cloud-init project is interested in being able to "consume and make use of the OpenStack project infrastructure".

The quotes above is per the Stackforge description at http://ci.openstack.org/stackforge.html .  I just want to make it clear that the cloud-init project and its developers are interested in use of the infrastructure, *not* in eventual OpenStack incubation or inclusion.  This is specifically because Openstack is just one of many uses of cloud-init.

The stackforge page implies that this is an acceptable use.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-31 14:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Adds cloud-init to StackForge

Cloud-Init is a cross-platform instance initialization tool, currently
lergely adopted on Linux based distributions.

Cloud-Init V2 supports Nova, EC2 and ConfigDrive metadata, Heat templates
and any OpenStack related content.

Cloud-Init V2 is a complete rewrite resulted from merging Cloud-Init with
Cloudbase-Init.

Change-Id: I586c29eae2a6c3aad3bc8dedd71160c89b5ed8e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 10:41:32.000000000', 'message': "Add neutron neutron_num_sync_threads variable

In the heat multi node test we were setting neutron_api_workers to 0.
We then noticed that the dhcp agent wasn't running correctly and Apsu
traced this back to num_sync_threads being set to 0 (currently, the
value of neutron_num_sync_threads will get set to neutron_api_workers if
neutron_api_workers is overriden).  While neutron's api_workers config
option can be set to 0, this is not a usable value for num_sync_threads.

This commit also changes a few instances of ``VCPUS`` to ``VCPUs`` in
documentation strings.

Change-Id: I0f8af934942e6ad58e0c9fd7bfad619d9e98a5bb
Closes-Bug: #1436916

commit_message:
Add neutron neutron_num_sync_threads variable

In the heat multi node test we were setting neutron_api_workers to 0.
We then noticed that the dhcp agent wasn't running correctly and Apsu
traced this back to num_sync_threads being set to 0 (currently, the
value of neutron_num_sync_threads will get set to neutron_api_workers if
neutron_api_workers is overriden).  While neutron's api_workers config
option can be set to 0, this is not a usable value for num_sync_threads.

This commit also changes a few instances of ``VCPUS`` to ``VCPUs`` in
documentation strings.

Change-Id: I0f8af934942e6ad58e0c9fd7bfad619d9e98a5bb
Closes-Bug: #1436916

commit_message:
Remove inspect_ports from ilo inspection

This commit removes the driver_info parameter
'inspect_ports' which was required for ilo driver
inspection. After this change, all the NICs detected
by iLO will be enrolled as Ironic ports and operators
are supposed to delete the Ironic ports for unused
NICs  manually (deploy may fail if all Ironic ports
are enrolled due to bug 1405131).

Closes-bug: 1438546
Change-Id: I37eb1dda649d4d21681555339c9ece8a18216f95

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 09:33:58.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamically determine hostname for MaaS checks

Currently, we assume hosts returned from a `nova service-list` and
`neutron agent-list` are FQDNs which is an incorrect assumption. The
original change was made as we ran these MaaS-related playbooks/roles
on hosts w/ incorrectly configured hostnames (meaning a `hostname`
would return the FQDN), and therefore the hosts being returned from the
above two commands were FQDNs.

This change replaces references to ansible_fqdn to ansible_nodename,
which uses a python platform.node() to obtain the hostname. This should
allow us to properly configure MaaS irrespective of whether or not an
installation has correctly configured hostnames on the individual nodes.

Change-Id: I7332fe0cb9d3470e19c720d7d12c9ba93c6a1ee3
Closes-Bug: #1439083
'}]
commit_message:
Dynamically determine hostname for MaaS checks

Currently, we assume hosts returned from a `nova service-list` and
`neutron agent-list` are FQDNs which is an incorrect assumption. The
original change was made as we ran these MaaS-related playbooks/roles
on hosts w/ incorrectly configured hostnames (meaning a `hostname`
would return the FQDN), and therefore the hosts being returned from the
above two commands were FQDNs.

This change replaces references to ansible_fqdn to ansible_nodename,
which uses a python platform.node() to obtain the hostname. This should
allow us to properly configure MaaS irrespective of whether or not an
installation has correctly configured hostnames on the individual nodes.

Change-Id: I7332fe0cb9d3470e19c720d7d12c9ba93c6a1ee3
Closes-Bug: #1439083

commit_message:
Clarify message for power action during cleaning

If someone tries to perform a power action on a node that is being
cleaned, they will get a message like 'The requested action
"power off" can not be performed on node "<identifier>" while
it is in state "power on".'

That message doesn't explain the problem. This changes the message
to '... while it is in state "cleaning".'

This addresses a nit in commit
I37dfe962e6c28ed9714f4d3ba8dc55894fc162d4.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states

Change-Id: I5983ce598ec1e82fcc5579b2ffaea27e68e259aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-17 22:17:14.000000000', 'message': 'Stop relying on configuration files being available for tests

We should not rely on configuration files located in etc/... and in
neutron/tests/etc/... when executing unit tests since those files are
not installed by e.g. pip install -U; otherwise *aas and other repositories
that rely on neutron test suite as a library will fail to execute their
unit tests if neutron is installed into their virtual environment not
via -e git:// requirements.txt directive (that still checks out neutron
code with the whole tree, including configuration files), but with pip
install -U, which will avoid installing test configuration files under
dist- or site-packages.

To achieve independency from the neutron tree checkout type, we should
generate configuration files for unit tests during runtime. It means
that now we should be able to kill static api-paste.ini.test and
neutron.conf.test files we maintained in the tree.

Some more changes are needed since now config_parse is not a static
method.

While at it, killed test_lib.test_config that seems to be unused by any
official neutron repository. Otherwise, the patch would require more
non-obvious changes in tests for no good reason.

Change-Id: If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889
Related-Bug: #1433146

code with the whole tree, including configuration files), but with pip
install -U, which will avoid installing test configuration files under
dist- or site-packages.

To achieve independency from the neutron tree checkout type, we should
generate configuration files for unit tests during runtime. It means
that now we should be able to kill static api-paste.ini.test and
neutron.conf.test files we maintained in the tree.

Some more changes are needed since now config_parse is not a static
method.

While at it, killed test_lib.test_config that seems to be unused by any
official neutron repository. Otherwise, the patch would require more
non-obvious changes in tests for no good reason.

- move config definitions in a separate file
- decide what to do with policy.json (nuke + provide file generator?)

Change-Id: If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889
Related-Bug: #1433146
'}, {'created': '2015-03-18 13:50:11.000000000', 'message': "tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

etc/... may be non existent in some build environments. It's also pip
does not install those files under site-packages neutron module, so
paths relative to python files don't work.

So instead of using relative paths to etc/... contents, maintain our own
version of configuration files. It means we need to maintain tests only
policy.json file too, in addition to neutron.conf.test and
api-paste.ini.test.

Ideally, we would make etc/policy.json copied under site-packages in
addition to /etc/neutron/. In that way, we would not maintain a copy of
policy.json file in two places.

Though it seems that setuputils does not have a good way to install
files under site-packages that would consider all the differences
between python environments (specifically, different prefixes used in
different systems).

Note: it's not *absolutely* needed to update the test policy.json file
on each next policy update, though it will be needed in cases when we
want to test policy changes in unit tests. So adding a check to make
sure files are identical.

This partially reverts commit 1404f33b50452d4c0e0ef8c748011ce80303c2fd.

Conflicts:
	neutron/policy.py

Related-Bug: #1433146
Change-Id: If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

commit_message:
tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

etc/... may be non existent in some build environments. It's also pip
does not install those files under site-packages neutron module, so
paths relative to python files don't work.

So instead of using relative paths to etc/... contents, maintain our own
version of configuration files. It means we need to maintain tests only
policy.json file too, in addition to neutron.conf.test and
api-paste.ini.test.

Ideally, we would make etc/policy.json copied under site-packages in
addition to /etc/neutron/. In that way, we would not maintain a copy of
policy.json file in two places.

Though it seems that setuputils does not have a good way to install
files under site-packages that would consider all the differences
between python environments (specifically, different prefixes used in
different systems).

Note: it's not *absolutely* needed to update the test policy.json file
on each next policy update, though it will be needed in cases when we
want to test policy changes in unit tests. So adding a check to make
sure files are identical.

This partially reverts commit 1404f33b50452d4c0e0ef8c748011ce80303c2fd.

Conflicts:
	neutron/policy.py

Related-Bug: #1433146
Change-Id: If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

New version system

According to new version system and packaging, version name should be
moved to all-dots (instead of the +). `packaging` directory moved as
well.

commit_message:
New version system

According to new version system and packaging, version name should be
moved to all-dots (instead of the +). `packaging` directory moved as
well.

Change-Id: I56d768784645998e3f885bde273dae81f9257831

commit_message:
Use 1/0 as booleans for DB2

DB2 stores booleans as 0 and 1. It does not recognize True/False.

Change-Id: Idaba2fa5bba259e69a1f92c531c3389b3293cf75
Closes-Bug: #1436674

commit_message:
Delete old Nuage net-partition record from db when a new one is created

This is seen when a default net-partition record exists in Neutron db
but is deleted from Nuage VSD. When Neutron is restarted, it recreates
the net-partition in VSD and also creates a new record in Neutron db
but does not delete the old one. The fix is to delete the old record
when a new one is added to db.

Change-Id: I40b7a1e6903fe800d9fecafe22e4ea1e2e8ff808
Closes-Bug: #1351078

commit_message:
Nuage Syncmanager needs external network info for sync

External network is mapped to a sharednetwork in VSD. When a gateway
is not set for an external network, Nuage backend cannot perform the
sync correctly. It needs information about the external net and its
subnets to create the sharednetwork in VSD.

Change-Id: If3ba20abc0511c847587f0fc771a9171f1498e02
Closes-Bug: #1373633

commit_message:
Improve backwards compat on API behaviour

As part of other changes for this release, we prioritised
descriptiveness over backwards compatibility.  In subsequent
discussions we've agreed this is incorrect.  This change
ensures that the same exception is raised on UUID not found.

Closes-Bug: #1438478
Change-Id: I44bb804186733016e8bbfc67987cdd4ad17b8151

commit_message:
Repo Updated for 9.0.7 tag

the repo version needed to be updated for the use within the tag. This
change is required to lock 9.0.7 to a particular version of the
pre-built python wheels.

Change-Id: I38491ca00dcca3e413f804a9edc78eb88402b90d

[{'created': '2015-03-23 20:00:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add flag to disable tempest with admin creds

This commit adds a new flag, DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_NO_ADMIN, which when
set to 1 will set TEMPEST_ADMIN_CONFIG to false in the localrc. This will
disable setting any admin credential information in the tempest.conf
file.

Change-Id: I29edf3c0739bf8d795ac1a8ee21453e674b6906f
Depends-On: Id983417801e4b276334fb9e700f2c8e6ab78f9ba
'}]
commit_message:
Add flag to disable tempest with admin creds

This commit adds a new flag, DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_NO_ADMIN, which when
set to 1 will set TEMPEST_ADMIN_CONFIG to false in the localrc. This will
disable setting any admin credential information in the tempest.conf
file.

Change-Id: I29edf3c0739bf8d795ac1a8ee21453e674b6906f
Depends-On: Id983417801e4b276334fb9e700f2c8e6ab78f9ba

commit_message:
Add short document on building guest images

It has long been felt that we need more (better) documentation on
building guest images. This document is a starting point in that
direction.

Authored-By: Amrith Kumar <amrith@tesora.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>

Change-Id: I2fe0cd1856778a47f1bfad2b9098a1f98e701f91

[{'account_id': 7293, 'date': '2015-03-30 14:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2015-03-30 14:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Fair enough, but I'd really like Neutron to get fixed -_-."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-30 14:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-oslo-incubator-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/24/168924/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/805ade4/ : SUCCESS in 1m 24s
- gate-oslo-incubator-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/24/168924/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/9f8c898/ : SUCCESS in 1m 01s
- gate-oslo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/24/168924/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/31193a0//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 24s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/24/168924/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/cb2fd8c/ : SUCCESS in 1m 18s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/24/168924/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python34/e8a194a/ : SUCCESS in 3m 06s'}, {'account_id': 14358, 'date': '2015-03-30 15:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In nova eventlet monkey-patching is done in parent process too. But it works well(signals,waitpid,eth). I think this issue should be investigated. There should be something that cause problems.

Why does neutron-server need two instances of ProcessLauncher? One ProcessLauncher has ability to run different services?'}, {'account_id': 7293, 'date': '2015-03-30 15:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Marian, in nova os module is not patched:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1c702054f941280c34cf64322220d378019f7eb5/nova/cmd/__init__.py#L24'}, {'account_id': 14358, 'date': '2015-03-30 15:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Regarding to commit message:
"2. Due to the fact that neutron-server initializes two instances
    of ProcessLauncher in one parent process, calling
    eventlet.greenthread.sleep(self.wait_interval) seems to be the
    only way for the process to switch contexts and allow another
    instance of ProcessLauncher to call _wait_child."
I try to understand logic of two instances of ProcessLauncher that work together in one process. Lets imagine that one child is died, and ProcessLauncher must respawn it, but there are two concurent waitpid(). So if wrong ProcessLauncher catch this event(when waitpid() returns PID of dead child) this child will not be respawned.'}, {'account_id': 7293, 'date': '2015-03-30 15:54:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't claim that this behavior is correct, for it is not, I just state the facts.
I think that we all have agreed that the way neutron-server uses ProcessLauncher needs to be reworked."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2015-03-30 16:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there a bug open for the Neutron issue?  It would be nice to have something to add as a Related-Bug here that will track the future work needed to make this work as intended.'}, {'account_id': 7293, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 7293, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:27:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Ben, I have filed a bug against Neutron. It'll be used to track this issue until there will be a proper bp."}, {'account_id': 14358, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:31:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Elena, you are right about nova's monkey-patching. Thanks for explanation."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks, Elena'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-30 17:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 14:17:08.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"

This reverts commit bf92010cc9d4c2876eaf6092713aafa94dcc8b35.

Although this change optimized waiting for children processes
to exit, it completely breaks neutron-server due to the following
reasons:

    1. In neutron-server eventlet monkey-patching is done in parent
    process. That is why os.waitpid(0, 0) in _wait_child method also
    gets monkey-patched and eventlet goes crazy. Connecting to parent
    process with strace shows that os.waitpid(0, os.WNOHANG) is
    called, yet it is difficult to say what is really happening
    because the process does not react on termination signals
    (SIGTERM, SIGHUP, SIGINT).

    2. Due to the fact that neutron-server initializes two instances
    of ProcessLauncher in one parent process, calling
    eventlet.greenthread.sleep(self.wait_interval) seems to be the
    only way for the process to switch contexts and allow another
    instance of ProcessLauncher to call _wait_child.

This revert is supposed to be temporary until the way neutron
launches services is reworked.

Conflicts:
	openstack/common/service.py

Change-Id: I5c75c4bf5f060e5d345fe4800bc92f5b4ed9206e

commit_message:
Revert "Optimization of waiting subprocesses in ProcessLauncher"

This reverts commit bf92010cc9d4c2876eaf6092713aafa94dcc8b35.

Although this change optimized waiting for children processes
to exit, it completely breaks neutron-server due to the following
reasons:

    1. In neutron-server eventlet monkey-patching is done in parent
    process. That is why os.waitpid(0, 0) in _wait_child method also
    gets monkey-patched and eventlet goes crazy. Connecting to parent
    process with strace shows that os.waitpid(0, os.WNOHANG) is
    called, yet it is difficult to say what is really happening
    because the process does not react on termination signals
    (SIGTERM, SIGHUP, SIGINT).

    2. Due to the fact that neutron-server initializes two instances
    of ProcessLauncher in one parent process, calling
    eventlet.greenthread.sleep(self.wait_interval) seems to be the
    only way for the process to switch contexts and allow another
    instance of ProcessLauncher to call _wait_child.

This revert is supposed to be temporary until the way neutron
launches services is reworked.

Conflicts:
	openstack/common/service.py

Related-Bug: #1438321
Change-Id: I5c75c4bf5f060e5d345fe4800bc92f5b4ed9206e

On some distributions, the default shell may be a different one (e.g.

commit_message:
Explicitly use bash in element scripts

Specify bash as interpreter, just like required by diskimage-builder.

On some distributions, the default shell may be a different one (e.g.
dash), which would break bash-specific functionalities.

Change-Id: I1f3140f3c1e938d7f28ccaac474b8e22d9fd7f40

[{'created': '2015-04-01 09:45:46.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the 'reference' format transform method

Currently, the 'reference' format transform method will traversal the
metrics list and reconstruct every item of the list to add tenant_id and
region info, but new transformed metrics list will use the reference
of the local dict variable "transformed_metric", that will lead that all
the items of the transformed metrics list be the same value.

Change-Id: Id7f4e18ca3ae0fa93cdafe0d63b7e90c96ce4b28
Closes-bug: #1439055
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the 'reference' format transform method

Currently, the 'reference' format transform method will traversal the
metrics list and reconstruct every item of the list to add tenant_id and
region info, but new transformed metrics list will use the reference
of the local dict variable "transformed_metric", that will lead that all
the items of the transformed metrics list be the same value.

Change-Id: Id7f4e18ca3ae0fa93cdafe0d63b7e90c96ce4b28
Closes-bug: #1439055

- gate-python-openstacksdk-pypy http://logs.openstack.org/75/169675/2/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-pypy/6c15411/ : SUCCESS in 1m 23s'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:39:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I want the service catalog in debug logging as it's actually been helpful to a bunch of us already while debugging. Without this, we'd have to just temporarily hack it back in there to know why we were getting double versioned endpoints in our code or why things weren't working right due to some of the unversioned endpoints, or just to know that I didn't receive a service catalog at all. We'd be in the dark on all three of those, but the service catalog in debug logging provides the root cause of a number of issues we may see in the SDK.

I could see why other projects might not want the catalog logged, but this project is the one place application developers are going to interact with OpenStack, so I don't want to remove a potentially useful piece of debugging information."}, {'account_id': 8736, 'date': '2015-04-01 13:49:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not a big fan of that change in KSC either, makes debugging OSC issues difficult."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ah, just forgot the unique nature of this project.
I have to tell keystonemiddleware to avoid returning catalog data then, :)

Will abandon this change.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2015-04-01 14:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

catalog data is essential for debugging SDK, this patch is inappropriate.'}]

commit_message:
Remove catalog from token dump in log

This patch filters out the catalog information from the dumped token
in logs. The catalog information is not interesting in most cases
but it wastes a lot screen space. This work is inspired by how the
python-keystoneclient filters out the catalog data.

This patch introduces a new dependency on oslo.serialization.

Change-Id: I1a207830e8ad3345cad8c0d3c848dad3f3719ab4

commit_message:
Copy S3 server implmenetation from Nova

Copy S3 server implmenetation and unit tests from Nova.
Add fileutils from oslo-incubator and refresh incubation modules.

Upgrade script doesn't copy buckets content because Nova S3 server
is not intended to be permanent full functionality object storage, but
has to be used temporary to CreateImage operation only.

Change-Id: I7d38b0a8e014dfff8238e7134d837d1074e4dd95

Fix string formatting for a secret store exception message

Fix the string formatting for the StorePluginNotAvailableOrMisconfigured
exception and add a check in the unit test to verify the message.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 14:07:52.000000000', 'message': 'spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
   puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ifbfcc86d2afa8a704710b3ed40957f2ff8167364
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

 * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
 * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests *
 * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x) *
 * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
 * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
   puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ifbfcc86d2afa8a704710b3ed40957f2ff8167364
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix a use of in where it should be equality

The pattern for most other comparisons against name_or_id are if
name_or_id in (name, id) - but in this case, because we're doing the
name exclusion parameter as well, we split them. However, we kept the
in, even though it should be testing for equality. This can cause some
failures that make people sad.

Change-Id: If33bfe5c1e32b36c27c32cfcba4c07dcf01a4e74

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-31 23:31:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use oslo util to determine network interface

Removes get_ip_address and use the oslo util instead.

The guest function get_ip_address assumes eth0 (as default, but no
functions pass the arg).
This causes failures if eth0 is not the network interface used.
oslo_utils has netutils.get_my_ipv4() which determines the interface
programmatically.

Change-Id: I6a9961df36662ccccaf46d5262b6b81306912333
Closes-bug: #1438941
'}]
commit_message:
Use oslo util to determine network interface

Removes get_ip_address and use the oslo util instead.

The guest function get_ip_address assumes eth0 (as default, but no
functions pass the arg).
This causes failures if eth0 is not the network interface used.
oslo_utils has netutils.get_my_ipv4() which determines the interface
programmatically.

Change-Id: I6a9961df36662ccccaf46d5262b6b81306912333
Closes-bug: #1438941

commit_message:
Multi Fabric NPIV

This change set supports the new configuration options for NPIV.  Will
create the client adapters based on the configuration settings, and load
balance the configuration accordingly.

Makes use of the new functions within pypowervm to place the mapping on
the Virtual I/O Servers and their ports, as well as remove them.

Due to the async nature of this operation within OpenStack however, we
have to store the port mappings to the system metadata of the VM.  There
are limits to the port mappings in the system metadata that will be
worked on in future change sets, but this is why each fabric has its own
element.

Provided associated unit tests as well.

Change-Id: I15ab22113c55d7c9985aa066aa1ee0faf3e170d7

commit_message:
create_disk_from_image with linked clone

Image LUs can't be mapped.  Disk LUs can't be uploaded.  In order to
create a disk for an LPAR, we have to make a Disk LU a linked clone to
an Image LU.

This change set augments create_disk_from_image to do the following:
o Check whether we already have an uploaded Image LU for this glance
image.  We key off of the LU name, which, for such Images, is
constructed with the keyword 'image' and the UUID of the glance image.
o If we don't already have the Image LU, create it and upload to it.
o Create a Disk LU linked clone to the Image LU.

Change-Id: I627d462fc06bc2307d39fde4bf85dc595551eab3

commit_message:
Fixes migrate_data utils to avoid created_at filed

migrate_data utils does not migrate table data if
table does not have column created_at field. It
fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Id179b295d8f0e0644420fb589baa5341d3020c7f
Closes-bug: #1439094

commit_message:
Rewrites the ClusterView.build_instances

There is a lot of similar code in build_instances versions of
normal and mgmt views for mongodb & vertica cluster strategies.

Rewrote the entire code to create a method ClusterView._build_instances
which could be used by both versions views(normal & mgmt)
and by both datastores viz. mongodb & vertica.

Change-Id: I8a63399af3d443de3e77af1202f227f71070635d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 12:37:34.000000000', 'message': 'Adds os-compute-api-type flag

--os-compute-api-type == "legacy"(default value) means that v1.1 and v2 is
used(API microversions protocol is not turned on).Default nova service
type is "compute".

--os-compute-api-type == "microversions" means that API microversions
protocol should be used when talking to the Nova API side. Default nova
service type is changed to "computev21"(needed  to get the correct api
entry point from keystone).

Change-Id: I5cf8de99e4ed140d704040b6877d76cb75566fc8
'}]
commit_message:
Adds os-compute-api-type flag

--os-compute-api-type == "legacy"(default value) means that v1.1 and v2 is
used(API microversions protocol is not turned on).Default nova service
type is "compute".

--os-compute-api-type == "microversions" means that API microversions
protocol should be used when talking to the Nova API side. Default nova
service type is changed to "computev21"(needed  to get the correct api
entry point from keystone).

Change-Id: I5cf8de99e4ed140d704040b6877d76cb75566fc8

I tried replacing jquery-1.11.0.js with jquery-1.11.2.js to no avail. I'm going to circle back with our web dev Wes to see if he can help me debug."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-02 21:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

- gate-openstackdocstheme-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/54/160354/3/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs/3c24bb7//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 14s'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-02 21:56:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Weird, I'm getting different behavior when building locally than when looking at http://docs-draft.openstack.org/54/160354/3/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs/3c24bb7//doc/build/html/

When you look at the above link built here, you go right to the anchor tags rather than expanding. When I click a link built with tox -e docs locally it does expand but doesn't link. Just wanted to clarify what I'm seeing."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-04 18:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-04 21:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

- gate-openstackdocstheme-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/54/160354/4/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs/ba66282//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 45s'}, {'account_id': 15002, 'date': '2015-03-09 09:15:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

It may be irrelevant, but the HTML code uses the <LH> (list header) tag, which was never part of the official standard. Could it cause trouble?
I have looked around a little bit but haven't found out yet where the <LH> comes from."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-09 12:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-09 12:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

- gate-openstackdocstheme-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/54/160354/5/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs/c2a9065//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 18s'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-09 12:58:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Not irrelevant at all, good catch Bernd. Could we use <label> instead? I'll poke around."}, {'account_id': 15002, 'date': '2015-03-10 06:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

<lh> is a red herring; the bitballoon mockup uses <lh> as well, and it seems to work. Still, it's probably a good idea to eliminate it at some point. 

What confuses me (and I am sure I miss something): When I look at the Bootstrap documentation e.g. http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#collapse, I find no mention of the ".active" class to implement the intended behaviour.'}, {'account_id': 15002, 'date': '2015-03-10 10:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Re Patchset 3, second comment: On the docs-draft site, Firebug reports "NetworkError: 404 Not Found - http://docs-draft.openstack.org/54/160354/3/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs/3c24bb7//doc/build/html/_static/js/jquery-1.11.2.js". This explains why the list is not expanded.

The current patchset seems to work except that clicking on a collapsed list header will open the list AND follow the link. I believe the intended behaviour is to only open the list. 
Does the list title ("Install Guides" etc) have to be hyperlinked?'}, {'account_id': 15002, 'date': '2015-03-10 10:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Discovered an error in docs.js, so obvious that it had escaped me until I used the debugger.

  $(".docs-sidebar-section-title").click(function () {
    $('.docs-sidebar-section').not(this).closest('.docs-sidebar-section').removeClass('active');
    $(this).closest('.docs-sidebar-section').toggleClass('active');
    event.preventDefault();
  });

forgets to put "event" in the callback function's parameter list, like so:

  $(".docs-sidebar-section-title").click(function (event) 

When I do that, however, jQuery stumbles over the URL in the <a> element of Install Guides. The debugger says "Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: http://docs.openstack.org/index.html#install-guides"
in the jquery-1.11.2.js file. What could this be?'}, {'account_id': 15002, 'date': '2015-03-10 10:44:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

It's the above error in docs.js that makes us follow the Install Guides link even if we just want to open the list. Unfortunately after fixing the error we run into the next one. It never stops."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-10 14:10:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've asked Todd Morey, one of the original web designers, for help with jquery going missing... thanks for the deep dive!"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-23 15:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2015-03-23 15:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

commit_message:
Prevent power actions on node in cleaning

Nodes that are in the middle of cleaning actions should not be able to
be powered off via the API. If a node were in the middle of a firmware
or BIOS update, it could cause the node to be damaged.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states

Change-Id: I37dfe962e6c28ed9714f4d3ba8dc55894fc162d4

commit_message:
Fix displaying of devref for TestModelsMigrations

One of the lists is displaying incorrectly in description of
results of output from TestModelsMigrations.

Change-Id: Ib400bb49b4189169c9e5ae1ba62e86aec4926fb1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 03:16:48.000000000', 'message': "Modify a different agent in test_update_agent_description

API test_update_agent_description modifies an agent's description, and
test_list_agent assumes the first agent is never modified. We make
sure that an agent other than the first one is modified.

Closes-bug: 1437124

Change-Id: I7593e2896ab7ef8a14ad35005314382e65e805cb
"}, {'created': '2015-03-27 20:42:17.000000000', 'message': "Modify a different agent in test_update_agent_description

API test_update_agent_description modifies an agent's description, and
test_list_agent assumes the first agent is never modified. We make
sure that an agent other than the first one is modified.

Closes-bug: 1437124

Change-Id: I7593e2896ab7ef8a14ad35005314382e65e805cb
"}, {'created': '2015-04-01 02:40:00.000000000', 'message': "Modify a different agent in test_update_agent_description

API test_update_agent_description modifies an agent's description, and
test_list_agent assumes the first agent is never modified. We make
sure that an agent other than the first one is modified.

Closes-bug: 1437124

Change-Id: I7593e2896ab7ef8a14ad35005314382e65e805cb
"}]
commit_message:
Modify a different agent in test_update_agent_description

API test_update_agent_description modifies an agent's description, and
test_list_agent assumes the first agent is never modified. We make
sure that an agent other than the first one is modified.

Closes-bug: 1437124

Change-Id: I7593e2896ab7ef8a14ad35005314382e65e805cb

commit_message:
Updates migrate_repo README

sqlalchemy migrate utility is being maintained by
Openstack Stackforge project, which was maintained
by google earlier. So the README is updated with
Stackforge project url.

Change-Id: I824d2ede84da8dd8a1488c0ca5e3ee0a71fb7810
Closes-bug: #1439023

Add the package builder script for debs

script gets under git revision

We expect error messages from this function but they can confuse people

commit_message:
Pipe destroy_vms output to a file

We expect error messages from this function but they can confuse people
who arn't aware that they are ok, so pipe them away from the console.

Change-Id: I2193c4f33119da158b4e17af251bf2685d207be7

commit_message:
Adds a user_only tag to RST files in Playground Guide

This patch adds a tag :scope: user_only to the RST files
from playground-user-guide folder that should output in
the End User Guide.

Change-Id: Ied8c7214433274dd1f8857e2f65519bb306e8652

[{'created': '2015-04-01 07:37:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix backend line syntax

Currently since only one node was the backend until this commit[1],
servername was deducted from the $::hostname fact. Since commit[1],
several node can be the backend for a service, so we need to provide
their servername also.

The current situation result with HAProxy refusing to start because
current lint look like

server  192.0.2.2:8776 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

when they really should look like

server MYHOSTNAME  192.0.2.2:8776 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

Resulting in error message : 'server' expects <name> and <addr>[:<port>]
as arguments.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168044/

Change-Id: I75424cf02f2d24308f33105f67d82a8d411e372d

commit_message:
Fix backend line syntax

Currently since only one node was the backend until this commit[1],
servername was deducted from the $::hostname fact. Since commit[1],
several node can be the backend for a service, so we need to provide
their servername also.

The current situation result with HAProxy refusing to start because
current lint look like

server  192.0.2.2:8776 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

when they really should look like

server MYHOSTNAME  192.0.2.2:8776 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

Resulting in error message : 'server' expects <name> and <addr>[:<port>]
as arguments.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168044/

Change-Id: I75424cf02f2d24308f33105f67d82a8d411e372d

(1 comment)

I'm -1'ing so we can have this conversation. I don't think mocking belongs in a library like shade, and that we can do better with the fakes that exist (and maybe even improve upon them). But I don't feel that strongly about this, so I don't want anybody to think this is a permanent position. Just something I think has merit at attempting."}, {'account_id': 11610, 'date': '2015-03-05 17:10:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So to clarify my thoughts on this after talking about them in #openstack-infra.  I'm actually happy with mock here.  I am unit testing a wrapper method so what I care most about is validating that all code paths are hit and handled and mock is perfectly suitable for accomplishing this task.  I think importing another projects test infrastructure is dubious at best.  These are typically not designed to be public interfaces as such and I think unit test failures caused by broken test infrastructure / libraries should be avoided at all costs.  I'm in the camp that thinks a unit test should only fail because the function its testing failed not because the test libraries it was using did.  Finally, I'm strongly in favor of integration testing which is where I think testing for things like API regressions actually belong."}, {'account_id': 11610, 'date': '2015-03-05 17:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

And it looks like Ricardo is already working on the mechanism to do integration testing in shade: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158463'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2015-03-05 19:07:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Hi Tim, so thanks for participating in the conversation.

We literally sit at opposite ends. I want the unit tests to fail if we're making erroneous assumptions about how novaclient and nova work. Mocks are just that: an assumption of how the library will work based on what it does today, whether that is right or wrong. That makes for some test coverage, but ignores that you may very well be mocking in bugs that will be fixed.

If nova changes behavior, and the fakes are updated to reflect that, then shade should break and I'd like to be able to rapidly iterate on that rather than need to spin up an entire nova to test that.

Of course importing something.tests is dubious. I've asked the nova devs and they're on the fence. They don't think that should change ever, but it might and they're not going to shed a tear for us when we explode because of it. But a good answer to that is for novaclient to go ahead and publish fakes that they consume in their tests, and that any end user can use. That would actually be a nice win for end-users and their development iteration if you think about it.

Anyway, I'm going to +1, because I think it's me against a sea of doubters on this one. I do think embracing the unverified mocking approach here is a valid approach; just not the one I would choose.

Thanks for participating in the discussion Tim. Live long and prosper \\//>"}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2015-03-06 01:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

See inline comment about splittingstuff up.'}, {'account_id': 11610, 'date': '2015-03-06 05:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-03-06 05:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add 'rebuild' to shade

Adding the ability to rebuild instances via shade.  While this is not
used by nodepool currently, there is some interest in evaluating whether
or not it could be a viable replacement for the current delete /
create strategy employed by nodepool.  Having rebuild in shade now will
make benchmarks a little simpler.

Change-Id: I12a00b71d248ce77e038dce1642d229587487886

commit_message:
Re-factor db sqlalchemy tests

Heat repository already contains sub-directory tests/db/. In this patch
we move all related with db sqlalchemy tests to mentioned sub-directory.
Also was removed redundant copy of file
heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_types.py. Code from this file was migrated to
heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_types.py file.

Change-Id: I337eeedc079e1146958ec3b4b1956d76ce7fc352

commit_message:
Use HeatTestCase as parent instead of testtools

Let's use base class for test, which allows to write scenarious tests in
child clases.

Change-Id: I8276513d6ce5a83ce1b46ff3107cc0e3223d9b4d

commit_message:
Makes Launch/ Edit buttons in Images explicit

The table actions, and thus detail page actions, are just listed as
Launch and Edit. This patch makes them Launch Instance & Edit Image.

Change-Id: I7e462d48547b3ab13e20ecb1e75d5bd7eab705b5
Closes-bug: #1435928

commit_message:
Updated keystone api for roles and edit

Creating a user does not associate roles properly.
Also updated the users patch code and tests.

Change-Id: I7a28fab574da94bc5933fc5a8d7dfa52f9d6fcc7
Implemenents: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

commit_message:
Add separate requirements.txt to integration tests

and use it during tox run. This should speed up the tox venv creation
somewhat, as the new requirements is shorter, thus less packages are
installed or C extensions compiled.

Also this is the first step to ease packaging of the integration tests
as a separate tool.

Change-Id: I914eb675e7f025e03a22719d5dff8ed741fbd37d

commit_message:
Update Trove to use novaclient v2

Novaclient v1.1 has been deprecated. Time to upgrade to v2.

Change-Id: I9b3ade8c324845bb9e62ddb98e86b04b1d37be9e
Closes-Bug: #1438247

commit_message:
Move os-client-config to openstack namepsace

After being part of the openstackclient project, the os-client-config
repo gets moved to openstack.

Change-Id: I313b76877400ebc61b4f384f2c25f48310f04521
Depends-On: I58c2280511c29b6235cd03ffaf05ecd8685a545e
